item.title: Cheap last minute Christmas trips with IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: Cheap Last Minute Christmas Trips. This year, forget cruising crowded parking lots at bulging shopping malls and enjoy an old world Christmas in exciting international destinations. Stress-free travel to these picturesque cities is affordable with deals on first class fares, business class tickets and last minute first class flights. From medieval towns filled with twinkling lights and quaint "chalets" to modern cities offering handmade crafts and traditional holiday spirit, Christmas markets present a relaxing and meaningful way to create unforgettable Christmas memories.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Last minute Christmas trips

 

Cheap Last Minute Christmas Trips

This year, forget cruising crowded parking lots at bulging shopping malls and enjoy an old world Christmas in exciting international destinations. Stress-free travel to these picturesque cities is affordable with deals on first class fares, business class tickets and last minute first class flights. From medieval towns filled with twinkling lights and quaint "chalets" to modern cities offering handmade crafts and traditional holiday spirit, Christmas markets present a relaxing and meaningful way to create unforgettable Christmas memories.

Bruges, Belgium
Beautiful, medieval Bruges fills its streets and lines its charming canals with holiday festivities. Shop to your heart's content in Market Square, where craft stalls, an ice rink, spiced wines, beer and Belgian chocolates satisfy all of your senses. The breathtaking Snow & Ice Sculpture Festival in nearby Station Square delights with a fantasy world of snow and ice based on Disney's new movie "Frozen." The ice festival lasts into the first week of January, so last minute first class tickets to Bruges to see the once-in-a=lifetime Disney display would make a great holiday gift.

Copenhagen, Denmark
The City of Spires becomes the city of lights, charm and Christmas pixies during the holidays. The second oldest amusement park in the world, Tivoli Gardens presents Julemarked, an enchanting open-air market filled with three miles of dazzling lights and 28 Christmas rides. The gorgeous old harbor district, Nyhavn, is just as engaging with handmade gifts, live music and Danish specialties like spiced wine and pastries. Make sure you have plenty of energy to explore all of Copenhagen's many holiday markets by traveling to Copenhagen in the comfort of first class fares. 

Nuremberg, Germany
For the true Christmas market experience, grab your business class tickets and head to Germany. Nearly every German town has an inviting holiday market, but few are as charismatic as Nuremberg's. Established in the 1500s, the market is one of Germany's most renowned holiday markets with nearly 200 shopping stalls and plentiful mulled wines, shimmering lights and fragrant greenery. Located in the heart of Old Town, Christkindlesmarkt is heralded in with trumpets and choirs from the magnificent Church of our Lady's balcony.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Strasbourg, France
Walk in the footsteps of four centuries of Europeans at the famous Strasbourg Christkindelsmärik. More than 300 "chalets" offer decorations, Alsatian pastries and crafts in front of the impressive Gothic Strasbourg Cathedral. Several other theme markets, Christmas villages and winter activities saturate the city with a cheerful ambiance and days of entertainment.

Toronto, Canada
Toronto may be known for its contemporary flair, but it embraces old world European allure in the historic Distillery District. An awe-inspiring 45-foot Christmas tree presides over numerous holiday activities, Santa's Lane and a host of mulled wine and beer gardens. Throughout the area, countless vendors' stalls brim with handmade crafts and decorations, and glimmering lights transform the entire district into a festive wonderland. 

Vienna, Austria
More than a dozen Christkindlmarkts fill the Viennese streets, celebrating traditions that date back to the Middle Ages. Creating a magical scene, the most popular market illuminates the grand Rathausplatz and its public square with lights, delectable Austrian treats, ice skating and music. In another, majestic Schönbrunn Castle is the backdrop to a large, bewitching Christmas tree, handmade crafts, carolers, children's programs and some of the largest pretzels you'll ever see.

Hundreds of other holiday markets keep the seasonal spirit alive, from London and Dublin to Philadelphia and Osaka. Create a magical holiday this year, beginning with the deluxe accommodations of discounted first class fares and business class tickets to enthralling destinations.

item.title: First Class Tickets Last Minute Discounts. Experience the World with Luxurious River Cruises.
item.summary: It's smooth sailing through the skies with incredible first class tickets last minute discounts. When combined with equally remarkable first class flights and spacious business class fares, a river cruise in a far-off land is a great way to discover foreign cultures, traditions and landscapes.
item.bodyColumn_1:
It's smooth sailing through the skies with incredible first class tickets last minute discounts.

Increasingly, travelers are discovering the pleasures of cruising on some of the world's most incredible waterways, from the lovely Danube to the mystical Mekong. When combined with equally remarkable first class flights and spacious business class fares, a river cruise in a far-off land is a great way to discover foreign cultures, traditions and landscapes.
Travelers are greeted with dozens of choices ranging from European idylls and Russian voyages to Asian odysseys and Africa safaris. Here are a few of the river cruises that we think will take your breath away. 

European Cruises

Rhine River Castles and Fortresses
The grand dame of all river cruises, the Rhine River jettisons travelers back to the Middle Ages, where clifftop fortresses stand guard and captivating castles house the indulgent elite. Running 766 miles through the heart of Europe, the Rhine offers brilliant views of Rhine Falls, Loreley Rock, majestic palaces and castles and Drachenfels volcano. Bountiful Rhine options include springtime cruises around Amsterdam to savor the vibrant tulips and winter routes through France and Germany to experience awe-inspiring Christmas markets.

Douro River Vineyards and Sunshine

Traversing Portugal's River of Gold takes travelers from the historic city of Porto to Spain's warm climes. Along the way, Baroque mansions, monasteries, rolling vineyards and charming villages offer a glimpse of Portugal's old world style. Today's river cruise ships on the Douro and elsewhere feature some of the most luxurious amenities available, with private balconies and lushly designed all-suite ships. Make the sojourn even more incredible with pampering first class flights and business class fares that will deliver you to Portugal in style.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Dnieper River's Cossock Adventure
Ukraine routes often begin with a Black Sea cruise through gorgeous Odessa, historic Yalta and ancient Sevastopol. Once on the Dnieper River, travelers enjoy exploring Cossock traditions in Zaporozhye, ancient forests, picturesque villages, Kiev's majestic St. Sophia Cathedral and the city's enchanting blend of Viking, Cossack and Ukrainian cultures. 
Asia

Yangtze River Mists and Mekong River Treasures
Travelers looking for unique experiences head to China's extraordinary Yangtze River or Cambodia's glorious Mekong River. Yangtze cruisers board at the ancient city of Chongqing, course through the magnificent Three Gorges limestone monoliths and relish the peals of the antiquated bronze bells of Wuhan. On the Mekong River, passengers embark in Kampong Cham, stream through villages with stunning Khmer temples and beautiful pagodas, tour the lovely waterfront capital of Phnom Penh and finish in My Tho's busy river port just minutes from Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh City.

The luxury of choices is yours, and the list grows as river cruising enjoys double-digit growth year after year. Some of the most recent exciting additions include Africa safari river cruises on the Chobe River, Northern Italy and Venice cruises on the Po River and Alaskan Inside Passage routes. Whether you prefer the Old World elegance of European cruises or the thrilling Asian tours, we can help you make your trip all the more luscious with unparalleled savings on magnificent first class flights and relaxing business class fares.

item.title: Last Minute First Class Airline. Relish Unique Adventures Beginning with Affordable First Class Fares.
item.summary: Getting the best last minute first class airline. Those childhood dreams of running off to join a circus or rocketing into outer space are more than just juvenile fantasies now that travelers are increasingly seeking unique adventures abroad. Our incredibly priced first class fares and business class seats can whisk you away to those exotic lands where you can embrace exciting, unusual experiences.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Getting the best last minute first class airline.

Those childhood dreams of running off to join a circus or rocketing into outer space are more than just juvenile fantasies now that travelers are increasingly seeking unique adventures abroad. Our incredibly priced last minute first class fares and last minute business class seats can whisk you away to those exotic lands where you can embrace exciting, unusual experiences.

The options for "immersion" travel are endless, from hand-rearing tiger cubs to working on a farm in Laos. To help you begin crafting your own remarkable immersion adventure, we offer five or our favorite world adventures.

French Culinary Tours
Awaken in historic French châteaus to sublime Provencal or Loire Valley sunrises with these outstanding culinary tours. Participants relish cooking lessons taught be skilled French chefs, touring local farms, shopping at local markets and enjoying private wine tastings. For discerning travelers who are looking for the ultimate French experience, gastronomic tours offer much more than just a taste of local flavor.

Spirituality in Bhutan
Embark on spiritually refreshing adventures in the stunning Himalayas and Kingdom of Bhutan. Its deeply preserved culture, rugged mountains and spectacular monasteries offer enriching encounters that will enhance your life. Ascend 10,000 feet to meditate with a Buddhist monk at the ragged cliff-side Tiger's Nest, Taktsang Palphug Monastery. The breathtaking 17th-century monastery is an important part of Buddhist history dating back to the 8th century and offers magnificent views and spiritual enlightenment for many.

Swiss Alps Adventure
You'll be grateful for the restful, pampering accommodations of first class fares and business class seats to Switzerland when you participate in a thrilling Swiss Alps glacial excursion. Rest in picturesque alpine chalets before hiking glaciers, climbing majestic mountains and mushing Siberian Husky teams across vast glaciers. Many alpine treks include opportunities to tour local farms, milk cows, make cheese, savor alpine cook-outs, river raft, explore castles and ride llamas.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Lion Clubs in South Africa
Jet away in luxury with first class fares to gorgeous Port Elizabeth, South Africa to participate in several wildlife preservation efforts. There is no better way to relish the majesty of South Africa's big cat predators than as a volunteer in an animal sanctuary or breeding program. Cuddle and feed baby lions and tigers, tend to young cheetahs and walk among giraffe and zebras as you absorb the region's appealing landscape and amazing wildlife. 

The Land of Aotearoa
Discover the stirring ancient Maori traditions, songs and legends that make New Zealand unique. Visitors stay in the traditional communal marae homes, participate in powhiri welcome ceremonies and learn to cook the customary hangi meals. From learning the culture's treasured dances and wood carving skills to taking guided forest walks, you'll marvel at the beauty and spirit of the Polynesian island culture.

Creating spectacular, immersing adventures can enrich your life and make your time away from home worthwhile and engaging. We can help you reach your stellar destinations in comfort with affordable, first class fares and business class seats that save you thousands of dollars. Exciting adventures await!

item.title: Last Minute Business Deals. Living La Grande Vie on the French Riviera.
item.summary: Indulge your senses this spring with a luscious visit to the Côte d'Azur and last minute business deals, where the vivid fucshia bougainvillea meet the bright blue Mediterranean sea.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Indulge your senses this spring with a luscious visit to the Côte d'Azur and last minute business deals, where the vivid fucshia bougainvillea meet the bright blue Mediterranean sea. To enjoy the full French Riviera experience, jet away in our luxurious first class seats to the Nice Airport for a month-long stay in spectacular villages like Cannes, Cap Ferrat, Antibes, St. Tropez and Nice. If you can't wait until spring for a dose of Mediterranean pleasure, chose one of our remarkably priced last minute first class flights to Nice for a quick, rejuvenating retreat. Either way, you'll revel in the South of France's high life and hobnob with other celebrities, royals and business moguls.

Rejuvenate
The craggy, dramatic coastline is full of small, private hotels, elegant palace resorts and private villas each offering its own magnificent luxuries. For the socially minded, exclusive hotels along Cannes' chic Promenade de la Croisette and Nice's Promenade des Anglais feature private beaches and resorts in the heart of the action. 

More private nights are spent on mega-yachts berthed in the Côte d'Azur's plentiful harbors. Those looking for complete privacy and security follow the lead of celebrities and royals who rent private villas or stay in resorts in quieter coastal towns such as Cap Ferrat, Villefranche-sur-Mer or Saint Paul de Vence. Or, choose the Hotel du Cap-Eden Roc near Antibes, where lodging is only available to those who have recommendations from regular guests. Whatever your choice, first-rate service, lush interiors and pampering amenities are de rigeur on the French Riviera.

Savor
Sunset aperitifs in seaside restaurants and clubs is a chance to be seen and enjoy the unique Mediterranean ambiance. Haute cuisine and Michelin-rated chefs are bountiful in this beautiful region, from Cannes' Le Moulin de Mougins and La Scena to Cap d'Antibes' Les Pecheurs and St. Tropez' Collette.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Play
The French Riviera is famous for its "play all day, party all night" attitude, and it offers plenty of ways to pass the balmy spring days. Shop for designer jewels and haute couture on Cannes' Promenade de la Croisette and Rue d'Antibes. Settle into a plush lounge on a private beach. Have a perfume custom-made at celebrated perfumeries. Take in a round of golf at elite, super-exclusive clubs like the private enclave known only by its nickname Le Prince de Provence.

The Côte d'Azur has the "party all night" part down pat with dozens of trendy nightclubs like Le Baoli and Les Caves du Roy. There, you can dance and carouse with celebrities and movie stars like Cameron Diaz, George Clooney and Leonardo DiCaprio. Or, go for the glamor of games of chance at the glittering coastal casinos such as Casino Croisette and Palm Beach Casino.

Whatever your pleasure, you will find it on the glittering French Riviera this spring. Combined with sumptuous last minute discounted first class seats and last minute first class flights, a holiday on the Côte d'Azur is a hedonistic feast for the senses and a prime example of la grande vie.

item.title: Last Minute First Class Deals to Asia with Luxurious Seats
item.summary: Last Minute Business Class, Cheap Business Class Airfares, Discounted Business Class Fares, Cheap first class last minute to asia. first class cheap fares, last minute, business class to hong kong
item.bodyColumn_1:
After the hectic pace of the holiday season, there's no better way to set your new year on the right track than with a luscious retreat in an exotic locale and the luxuriously affordable first class tickets and business class seats to take you there. From seaside resorts offering sumptuous tranquility and wellness classes to "vinotherapy" in the European hillsides, there are countless resorts and retreats that offer the space, scenery and service travelers seek. Get Last Minute First Class Deals to Asia


To help you begin planning your relaxing or energizing retreat, we've compiled just a few of the incredible resorts that are catching worldwide attention. While now is a great time to book winter first class tickets, there's no need to worry if you need a few more weeks to choose a destination. Our incredible last minute first class fares and last minute business class flights receive the same stellar discounts as our planned flights and can often cost less that coach. Either way, you can look forward to a magnificent and rejuvenating journey at a fraction of the usual cost.

Getting Back to Nature
Emirates Wolgan Valley Resort & Spa, Australia
Soak in the beauty of Australia's Blue Mountains from the 4,000-acre reserve. With horse riding, nature walks and wildlife safaris led by personal guides, the resort encourages guests to explore nature. Spa treatments include signature escapes such as a four-hour Australian sunset ritual, massage, facials and numerous body treatments. 

Yoga 
Domaine de la Grausse
Clermont La Grausse, France
Rejuvenate body and soul with morning and evening yoga lessons in the magnificent French Pyrenées. Located in an enchanting 18th-century château, this retreat offers yoga classes suitable for all, guided meditation and a variety of relaxing holistic treatments. The open schedule leaves plenty of time to explore the region's waterfalls, nearby cave paintings and the picturesque town of St. Lizier.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Bodhi Khaya Retreat
Gansbaai, South Africa
Morning meditation and a fynbos labyrinth help clear the mind at this wellness complex. Dozens of workshops are offered here, ranging from zen and qi gong to vegetarian cooking and life transformation. The nearby Atlantic Ocean offers more peaceful pursuits, from warm, soft sand beaches and incredible whale watching. Getting to the Bodhi Khaya is a visual treat when you schedule your business class seats or first class tickets to land in Cape Town and then drive down the beautiful coast to the Overberg estate.

Health Retreat
Les Sources de Caudalie
Bordeaux, France
Rest amid the engaging vineyards of Bordeaux in this lush health retreat. From vinotherapy treatments, body wraps and massages that relax and rejuvenate your body to cellar wine tasting courses that please your palate, Les Sources is ideal for those interested in wine and wellness. A hot underground spring soaks away the stresses of the world and curative, antioxidant-based treatments address your body's internal balance.

Whatever spiritual, health or fitness retreat soothes your mind and helps you prepare for a fantastic year, we are happy to help transport you there in deluxe style. Call us today to book your business class seats or first class tickets to amazing international retreats.

item.title: Cheap Last Minute Business Class Australia Offers by IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: Experience the cheap last minute business class to Australia. You'll live the life of the rich and famous, jetting away in the splendor of first class fares or spacious business class seats to a private tropical island equipped to cater to your every need.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Cheap Last Minute Business Class Australia

 

Experience the cheap last minute business class to Australia. You'll live the life of the rich and famous, jetting away in the splendor of first class fares or spacious business class seats to a private tropical island equipped to cater to your every need. From amazing coral cays along the Great Barrier Reef and "motu" in Tahiti to Fiji's verdant islands, the only difficult part of a private island escape is deciding which Polynesian paradise to choose. We've compiled a list of our favorite South Pacific luxury island retreats; here is our first installment showcasing sumptuous islands in Australia and New Zealand.

No Worries in the Land Down Under

Leave cold Northern winters behind to bask in the gleaming sunshine and warm water of the Great Barrier Reef. Settle into the balmy Tropic of Capricorn on spectacular Heron Island, known for its incredible dive sites and soft-sand beaches. Reserve the entire island or a luscious resort suite, and revel in the sumptuous amenities, guided ecological walks, tennis courts and swimming pool and evening cinema presentations. Take a short boat ride to the more secluded Wilson Island, where the coral island's fine sand offers a unique habitat for rare turtle and bird breeding grounds. 

Australia's coast offers plenty of other full-service island choices. Take a walk on the wild side and chance an encounter with Lizard Island's immense Monitor Lizards, relax in Orpheus Island's sheltered bay or experience the pampering amenities and incredible oceanside villas on the Whitsundays' Hayman Island. Mostly islands are located off Australia's east and northeast coasts, so reserve first class fares to Brisbane or Cairns to connect with island transfers via seaplane, helicopter and yacht.

Haere Mai, Welcome to New Zealand

We love New Zealand for its casual, engaging approach to life, and its islands are just as enticing. Wooded hills, pristine beaches and frolicking dolphins create a tranquil respite on Marlborough Sounds' Forsyth Island. Snuggled between New Zealand's North and South islands, Forsyth is the quintessential Kiwi adventure, complete with welcoming lodge, marvelous cuisine and bountiful water sports. To get there, settle into comfortable business class seats to Wellington, and transfer to Forsyth aboard a breathtaking 20-minute helicopter ride.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Off New Zealand's Coromandel Peninsula, Slipper Island is less remote yet equally appealing, with traditional bure-styled chalets facing gorgeous beaches and an inviting inland lodge. Wreck-diving, wind surfing and deep-sea fishing are just a few island activities. A luscious first class fare to Auckland will deliver you near the serene Kiwi island, and a quick boat transfer, helicopter ride or private flight can take you the rest of the way.

Luxuriating in your own South Pacific island retreat is the perfect way to spend the holidays or start the new year. Take a look at our many last minute first class deals for a quick getaway or plan next year's adventure with our deeply reduced first class fares and business class seats. Be sure to check back in for our suggestions for other Polynesian paradise islands.

item.bodyColumn_1:
Special Business Class Flight to Singapore

Business Class Flight Specials to Singapore.  Enjoy Your Flight withIflyFirstClass.

Singapore – One of the Most Exciting Destinations. 

Being a city of contrasts, where modernity blends with tradition, Singapore attracts millions of visitors from all over the world. This cosmopolitan city-state offers myriads of opportunities and fantastic experiences. With our business class flight specials to Singapore, flying to the Malay Peninsula with IflyFirstClass will bring considerable benefits, such as cost savings without compromising on comfort. 

Focus on Diversity.

Singapore is notable for a mix of cultures, cuisines, traditions, and languages, concentrated on the total area of 697 sq km. Being one of the smallest states in the world, it is situated in the heart of Southeast Asia. Singapore includes 63 islands, where you can find everything from modern cities to national parks. 

Singapore caters for all tastes and offers visitors great opportunities to enjoy their vacation:

  • Modern infrastructure.

Singapore is an urbane city that is filled with giant skyscrapers, numerous shopping malls, restaurants, cafes, religious institutions, and other buildings in immediate proximity to each other. With its modest total area, Singapore is one of the most densely populated countries in the world. 

  • National parks.

Singapore can be called a Garden City. It abounds in various nature reserves, like Bukit Timah Nature Reserve, HotPark, Botanical Gardens, MacRitchie Reservoir, etc. Here visitors can find amazing varieties of flora and fauna. Besides, Singapore introduces a lot of environmental initiatives, which allow keeping the state clean and environmentally friendly.
item.bodyColumn_2:
• Cuisine.

Singapore’s food culture is greatly appreciated by millions of visitors. Food tours to Singapore are extremely popular. The country’s cuisine is diverse and can satisfy the most sophisticated tastes. The World Gourmet Summit and Singapore Food Festival welcome visitors from all over the world.

  • Shopping.

Both locals and visitors really enjoy shopping in Singapore. Its Orchard Road malls include more than 20 shopping centers connected by a number of underground tunnels, passages, covered escalators, sheltered walkways, and the train line. 

  • Other types of entertainment.

Use Special offer to Singapore. You can also offer pleasure cruises down the Singapore River, relaxation on beautiful beaches, fantastic nightlife, and plenty of other entertainment opportunities.

Australia

Australia is the only country that occupies a whole continent. It is popular among tourists from 

all over the world for its cultural and natural treasures. Australia abounds in fascinating sites,

• Cosmopolitan cities. Being the sixth-largest country by land area, Australia has a high 

level of urbanization. Its largest cities, including Melbourne, Sydney, and Perth, can offer 

cosmopolitan attractions that suit all tastes and budgets. 

• Fantastic beaches. Australia is famous for its beautiful sandy beaches, where visitors can 

relax and enjoy lavish entertainment. 

• Wonderful national parks. Australia’s numerous national parks, such as the Great Sandy 

National Park, Kakadu National Park, Purnululu National Park, and Uluru-Kata Tjuta 

National Park, attract visitors from all over the world. 

• Amazing lakes. In Australia, there are many pink lakes that look fantastic when viewed 

from the air. 

• Exotic wildlife. Such animals as koala bears, kangaroos, emus, wallabies, possums, 

dingos and others can be found only in Australia.

item.bodyColumn_1:
How to Get One Way First Class Cheap?

When you and your family decide to go abroad on a long vacation to spend some time away from home, you have to think about the budget. Allocating a certain amount of money for this very luxurious trip is a must before you begin planning. However, this can be a difficult task as the price of tickets is extremely high. This is especially true when you are travelling to another part of the world. This is the reason why most people are forced to pre-book months in advance. While you may do this and save a little on the overall cost, there are more disadvantages than the good. Booking several months in advance can cause many problems. A person or a working couple cannot ask for a leave two months in advance from their workplace. If you assume that you will be granted a leave and at the end you are not, then you may have to sell your tickets or cancel the booking, incurring more loss. Same is the case with kids studying in school. There are alternatives to this and you can get cheap first class fares via other means.

For a family the alternatives are plenty and while choosing an economy airliner is one of the options, it is not the best option to go for. It all comes down to tactics and strategy that you can utilize to get the best deals. Every country has peak seasons in which the tourists visit the place. This is also the time when airliners increase their costs to as much as double the actual rates and mint money. You have to be smart and seek destinations to visit in the off season.
item.bodyColumn_2:
You can get cheap business class airfare for the entire family and enjoy some quiet time at your dream destination. Since it will be off season, you can even expect a lesser crowd and more peace of mind.

In case you are an executive or the owner of a recently launched company, then there is no alternative left for you rather than travel by the best flight. This is because it comes down to reputation and affects the way people look at you. If you are a frequent flyer, then you can make use of your frequent flier miles card that many airliners provide. You can redeem the miles covered for points and use them to get the best deals business class. This is an option that not many people make use of even though it is perfect for executives.

A person may not necessary go with family or on a business trip to other parts of the world. There are many who just want a get away with some friends and the timing does not really matter to them. There is an option for cheap last minute first class seats for these people and it requires the group to be on their toes. All you have to do is wait for cancellation and board the flight with friends and head to the destination of choice.

item.title: One Way Business Class Deals. IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: With one way business class deals, pampering services and top-tier accommodations, today's best business class offerings are more like first class cabins than ever. Key to this luxurious transformation is the inclusion of plush, spacious seating and plenty of bells and whistles to make long journeys productive and restful. Many of the world's top airlines have spent millions of dollars installing the newest, most comfortable seats available, and here are our top picks for the best business class seats in the industry.
item.bodyColumn_1:
With one way business class deals, pampering services and top-tier accommodations, today's best business class offerings are more like first class cabins than ever. Key to this luxurious transformation is the inclusion of plush, spacious seating and plenty of bells and whistles to make long journeys productive and restful. Many of the world's top airlines have spent millions of dollars installing the newest, most comfortable seats available, and here are our top picks for the best business class seats in the industry.

Today's business class seats are all about "intelligent" seat design, extra shoulder room and recline options that include a full-flat bed. At No. 10 on our list, China Southern Airlines includes all of those features, touting its new business class seat as a "couch in the air." And, at a fully flat position, the seats stretch to a roomy and near sofa-like 75-to-85-inch long bed. 

Trendy Virgin Atlantic, at No. 9, offers precious privacy with a suite-like setting, super-long beds and direct access to aisles. 

Eighth place Korean Air similarly fills its business class cabin with the roomy Prestige Sleeper seats that recline 180 degrees and to various points in between at the touch of a button. 

Beloved Qantas hits the list at No. 7, offering discerning travelers its award-winning Skybed seats with multiple recline positions, ample storage and a flat 77-inch bed with turn-down service. 

This year, No. 6 Air France is rolling out its $500 million investment in new cabins with beds sporting leather upholstery, 16-inch high definition touchscreens and a full-flat bed with padded headboard, super-soft duvet and extra-large down pillow. 

Whether travelers are aboard No. 5 Singapore Airlines' new business class fares, long-haul flights or regional flights, they can expect the signature Singapore luxury. Its sophisticated new seating maximizes privacy and touch-button functionality and provides two new reclining positions.
item.bodyColumn_2:
At No. 4, Emirates is standard bearer in the upper tier of business class accommodations. Its new A380 and most B777 aircraft feature top-of-the-line seats that convert to full-flat beds extending 79 inches. The seats recline using a touchscreen and present plentiful storage, in-seat power supply and a built-in minibar. 

A titan in the industry, Cathay Pacific rests at No. 3 with new A330 business class seats that include retractable arm rests, swivel tables, power supply, a shoe locker and a spacious flat bed.

In second place, luxurious Qatar Airways' new B787 business class cabins offer unmatched comfort, productivity and privacy. Lie flat on Italian Frette linens or recline to work or play on a personal dual-screen hand-held device. 

At the top of several lists this year is Japan Air Lines, or JAL. Its international business class sky suites are a world apart, showcasing a full-flat bed with specially designed "airweave" pillows and mattresses. Direct aisle access, bountiful storage and plenty of shoulder and leg room guarantee that passengers enjoy a peaceful flight in JAL's business class.

For more information about the world's best business class deals and accommodations, visit IFlyFirstClass online at www.iFlyFirstClass.com or call 1-888-347-7817.

item.summary: About business class fares to Europe. Keeping premium travelers entertained, relaxed, well-fed and pampered between flights is a multi-million dollar endeavor for the world's top airlines. And, with each air carrier striving to surpass its competitors, passengers enjoy an exceptional array of lounge services and amenities. Five business and first class lounges are particularly notable for their commitment to personal service and stellar accommodations.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Cheap Business Class Airfares to Europe

 

About business class fares to Europe: 

Keeping premium travelers entertained, relaxed, well-fed and pampered between flights is a multi-million dollar endeavor for the world's top airlines. And, with each air carrier striving to surpass its competitors, passengers enjoy an exceptional array of lounge services and amenities. Five business and first class lounges are particularly notable for their commitment to personal service and stellar accommodations.

Lufthansa 

So swanky that its first class passengers have their own private Frankfurt terminal, Lufthansa turns attentive service into an art form. The two-story first class terminal encases nearly 6,000 square feet of space and houses the ultimate in first class luxury. Passengers are greeted by valets and personal assistants at the terminal, ensuring cars are parked, luggage is transferred, and passengers are whisked through security and check-in. Inside, passengers relax on daybeds in quiet rooms, light up in the Cigar Lounge, and dine on an extensive menu and buffet. Private office units provide all of the peace and connectivity passengers need to be productive while shower rooms delight with fluffy bathrobes and luxurious toiletries. All the while, personal assistants are on-hand to ensure passengers have everything necessary for a flawless experience.

Virgin Atlantic

Virgin Atlantic continues to delight Upper Class passengers at its chic London Heathrow lounge, the Clubhouse. Virgin excels at trendy, hip design and bountiful service. The lively Clubhouse bar keeps beverages flowing and passengers socializing, while the Den entertains gamers and movie buffs. Ample culinary delights are on offer, from an English breakfast and British tapas to deli fare and seared salmon. A tranquil floor-to-ceiling water wall burbles away in the relaxing lounge, and a sundeck invites passengers to snooze between flights. The Clubhouse also offers the only airport-based fully digital audio production studio in the world.

Qantas 

Perennial favorite Qantas operates one of the world's best first class lounges in Sydney. Masterfully designed by Marc Newson, the posh First Lounge features high-end furnishings, including Poltrona Frau leather upholstery on recliners. Its spa offers facials, massages and other rejuvenating treatments with products from Payot, Paris. For refreshments, the bar overflows with wine, champagne and other invigorating spirits, while the fresh, seasonal menu is designed by renowned restaurateur Neil Perry.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Cathay Pacific 

The Wing first class lounge is Cathay Pacific's signature lounge, a favorite of savvy travelers and recently renovated to continue its legacy as one of the best in the world. From top-notch furnishings and exquisite detailing to pampering service, the lounge fulfills every passenger need. Passengers sip bubbly in the champagne bar, dine on the finest fare in The Haven and relax in shower-equipped cabanas. 

Cathay Pacific's multi-level The Wing business class lounge in the Hong Kong Airport is equally vaunted. White carrera marble surrounds a scrumptious buffet of Asian and Western dishes, and plentiful shower suites feature warm bamboo and Travertine stone. Its legendary Noodle Bar and The Long Bar offer more edible treasures as does The Coffee Bar.

New and innovative services continue to be added to first and business class lounges across the globe. Qatar Airways' Doha Airport lounges are frequently acclaimed, but their new Hamad International first and business class lounges are still under construction and highly anticipated. For more information about other incredible first and business class offerings, visit www.iFlyFistClass.com or call 1-888-347-7817.

item.title: Discount First Class Airline Tickets With IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: Staying connected while in the air is easier than ever with new and ever-expanding Internet services on the nation's biggest airlines. Customer demand for business class first discounted tickets. With an accelerating pace of expanding Wi-Fi networks, increasing speeds, improving function and widening global service coverage, in-air Internet offerings are expected to balloon in the next three years.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Discount Business Class Tickets

 

Staying connected while in the air is easier than ever with new and ever-expanding Internet services on the nation's biggest airlines. Customer demand for business class first discounted tickets. With an accelerating pace of expanding Wi-Fi networks, increasing speeds, improving function and widening global service coverage, in-air Internet offerings are expected to balloon in the next three years. 

Current In-Air Offerings
In-flight Internet pioneer GogoAir created the very first in-air wireless broadband network in the world and now provides total in-flight broadband coverage across the continental United States on more than 2,000 commercial aircraft and more than 6,500 business aircraft. Its air-to-ground network in North America is one of the most extensive in the world, and it's expanding and innovating to meet growing demand. 


Its comprehensive network and stellar track record for robust coverage has led to partnerships with many of North America's top airlines. Currently, passengers can access GogoAir's in-flight connections on Aeromexico, American Airlines, Air Canada, AirTran, Alaska Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Frontier Airlines, United Airlines, US Airways and Virgin America. 

Streaming movies and videos in-flight is a developing service. While most networks need more bandwidth and stronger signals to provide a satisfying streaming experience, GogoAir offers about 100 on-demand movies to its customers. These GogoAir in-flight entertainments options can be found on partner air carriers such as Aeromexico, American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Scoot and US Airways. 

In the Future: Expanded, International Coverage and Faster Connections
While a recent study published by the World Bank reported that the U.S., Canada and Germany have the most extensive in-air Internet networks, other countries and regions are recognizing its importance. After all, no country can afford to be the dead zone for Internet service in an otherwise robust coverage area.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Faster, stronger, wider and more reliable coverage is already in the works for many in-air broadband services. GogoAir, for example, will soon offer its 2Ku network that uses a series of satellites to provide complete connectivity, even over oceans and distant lands. Travelers can expect to see connectivity broaden on international flights and become more reliable with these expansions. 

Increasing connection speed is another top priority. One provider announced this spring that it will debut a new satellite in 2017 that will deliver in-flight connection speeds at 200 Mbps.

Paving the way for more innovation, some current restrictions on in-air mobile device uses are being eliminated. The European Commission recently approved a resolution to allow passengers to make 3G and 4G cell phone calls once they're above 3,000 feet. Fliers passing through EU airspace will also be able to text and use their mobile devices.

Whether flying internationally or domestically, busy clients of leading luxury travel service IFlyFirstClass need to be able to stay in touch with their offices, partners and clients throughout their flights. For that reason, IFlyFirstClass always recommends that its travelers choose first and business class flights with the most reliable and extensive networks available. 

Ultimately, industry experts believe these growing in-flight Wi-Fi networks will lead to more sophisticated services with a complete range of low-cost connectivity. Leading the way in this effort is in-air broadband pioneer GogoAir.

item.summary: Bustling, historic, fashionable and mysterious, London is the busiest destination in the world. Knowledgeable travelers who choose to have a business class flight deals to London just as spectacular as the destination, count on IFlyFirstClass for cheap business class flights and discounted first class seats. item.bodyColumn_1:
Business Class Flight Deals to London

 

Bustling, historic, fashionable and mysterious, London is the busiest destination in the world. Knowledgeable travelers who choose to have a business class flight deals to London just as spectacular as the destination, count on IFlyFirstClass for cheap business class flights and discounted first class seats. With the best deals first class has to offer, travelers can rest assured that they have plenty of money and energy left to explore The Smoke.

Exciting London

Known for its stellar architecture, powerful international acumen, trend-setting music and fashion scenes and fascinating royalty, London is a whirlwind of activity. With the Thames River running alongside some of the city's most iconic landmarks like the Palace of Westminster and Big Ben, the London Eye and the Tower of London, the city sports some of the most picturesque landscapes around.

Politicos and royal-watchers enjoy taking in the legendary 10 Downing Street residence of the prime minister and the official royal family residence at Buckingham Palace. Westminster Abbey is also a favorite destination for its role in elaborate coronations and royal weddings. Equally fascinating are St. Paul's Cathedral, Kew Gardens, Trafalgar Square, Windsor Castle and Kensington Palace.

Modern Landmarks with Awesome Views

As a dynamic, innovative city, London excels at blending its stunning new structures into its historic districts. Creating spectacular views of the city, the London Eye presents magnificent views of Westminster Palace, and the super-modern Shard building gives guests a 72-story-high vista of the city. In addition to its captivating architecture, The Gherkin also tempts visitors to take a peek at London from 41 stories in the air.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Center Stage in London's Art Scene

The famous West End is the heart of London's theater district and a must-see for musical theater lovers. Nearby, Picadilly Circus overflows with exciting restaurants, nightclubs and neon signs that give it a Times Square vibe. Fashion houses and upscale shops fill Oxford and Bond streets, and the renowned Tate Modern houses dozens of modern art exhibits.

Mysterious London

The city is infamous for its macabre, unsolved murders, ghostly apparitions and often-violent political machinations of the past. Visitors can trail the killing grounds of Jack the Ripper, trudge through a camped-up tour of the London Dungeon, ride a Ghost Bus, take the Blood and Tears Walk and explore the history-filled Highgate Cemetery.

The IFlyFirstClass Advantage

item.bodyColumn_1:
One Way Business Class China

 

Get the business first one way class to China. 

Drawn to vast China's deep artistic, spiritual and historic heritage and the second largest economy in the world, business and pleasure travelers thrill to their Chinese adventures. Experienced travelers make their trek to China in affordable luxury, thanks to IFlyFirstClass' discounted business class and cheap first class flights. The leading premium travel service accesses the very best deals first class can offer so that travelers can save thousands on high-end airfare and enjoy the long flight to gorgeous China.

The Land Of The Sleeping Giant 

A journey to China can span from the country's cosmopolitan urban cities on the east coast to the rich river deltas in the central area and on to the picturesque Inner Mongolian grasslands of the west. As the country with the world's largest population, it's no surprise that China boasts a few other peerless features. Its Mount Everest is the world's tallest mountain; its Gobi Desert is 1,000 miles wide; its high-speed magnetic levitation train reaches an unheard-of 300 miles an hour and its Great Wall spans more than 13,000 miles. All are spectacular experiences for visitors to China.

Chinese Adventures

With vast landscapes and climates, China presents a variety of recreation activities, from rafting down the country's mighty rivers and soaking in Yalong Bay's tropical beach wonderlands to traipsing across hundreds of glacier on Xinjiang's Mount Tomur and cycling along Xian's great wall. Whatever thrill-seeking visitors enjoy, they'll be glad they traveled to the country in the restful comfort of IFlyFirstClass' discounted business class and first class seat.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Cultural Discoveries

Visitors can explore the country's many temples and churches to gain insight into China's traditional architecture, religion and culture. And, since the country has been home to a variety of religions, visitors can explore how many different faiths shaped China's regions. In the 6th century, for instance, the Tiantai branch of Buddhism was formed with the creation of Mount Tiantai's Guoging Temple. Decades later, Islam was first introduced into Chinese culture in Ghangzhou City. That city remains home to one of the oldest mosques in the world, the Huaisheng Mosque, built in 627 A.D. With the building of the Trans-Siberian Railway came Russian influence, seen in Saint Sophia Cathedral's onion domes. And, in a country as expansive as China, there are dozens of other temples, churches and cathedrals to experience.

The IFlyFirstClass Advantage
Globetrotters using IFlyFirstClass can expect unparalleled service and the very best first class deals on offer. Whether travelers are seeking one way first class flights for business or last minute first class tickets for a spur-of-the-moment retreat, IFlyFirstClass offers outstanding deals.

item.title: Last Minute Emirates Flights With IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: Business first last minute flights to Emirates. Emirates launched its new Chicago-to-Dubai nonstop route earlier this month with a Grand Ballroom gala at the Navy Pier, and Donna Cherry, CTO of IFlyFirstClass was there to help celebrate. As a leading luxury travel service, IFlyFirstClass is always delighted when a proven luxury airline extends its routes to the U.S., but Emirates' unparalleled service and amenities is of particular interest to the company.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Last Minute Emirates Flights

 

Business first last minute flights to Emirates are watiign for you! 

Emirates launched its new Chicago-to-Dubai nonstop route earlier this month with a Grand Ballroom gala at the Navy Pier, and Donna Cherry, CTO of IFlyFirstClass was there to help celebrate. As a leading luxury travel service, IFlyFirstClass is always delighted when a proven luxury airline extends its routes to the U.S., but Emirates' unparalleled service and amenities is of particular interest to the company.

"With our global economy expanding, travel between the U.S. and the Middle East is vital for hundreds of Midwest entrepreneurs and executives," said Donna with I Fly First Class. "We are excited to work with Emirates to deliver our clients to the Persian Gulf and beyond in the luxury of direct first and business class flights from Chicago."

The addition of the Emirates daily flights between Chicago and Dubai makes Chicago the second U.S. market to provide service from three major airlines based in the Middle East. Etihad entered the market in 2010 and Qatar Airlines began offering flights from Chicago to Doha in 2013.

"IFlyFirstClassclients require convenience, luxury and value, and Emirates' entry into the Chicago market gives us a terrific option to provide to our customers," said XXXXXX. "Known for its award-winning service and cabins, the Chicago-to-Dubai flights help our clients connect with their business interests in Dubai and 140 other global destinations."

Those flying Emirates' new nonstop route will enjoy first, business and economy class fares on the airline's spacious Boeing 777 aircraft. IFlyFirstClass has already added the new route to its offerings and is pleased to book its clients into Emirates' first and business class cabins. 

These new nonstop routes consist of flight EK236, leaving O'Hare International Airport at 8:35 p.m. and arriving in Dubai at 7:10 p.m. aboard the Boeing 777-200LR aircraft. Return flight, EK235, flies out of Dubai International Airport on alternate days at 9:45 a.m. and arrives in Chicago at 3:25 p.m.
item.bodyColumn_2:
At Emirates' launch gala, company executives announced that 85 percent of the company's flights for August were already booked.

Local dignitaries welcomed Emirates executives and the arrival of the very first Emirates flight to O'Hare International Airport on August 5 with plenty of fanfare. Continuing the celebration, the airline's August 6 gala attracted more than 500 travel industry executives, business leaders and VIPs to the event, including IFlyFirstClass' Donna Cherry.

Offering just a taste of the luxury Emirates' passengers can expect aboard the Chicaco-to-Dubai flight, the launch gala pulled out all the stops. Emirates Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer Adel Al Redha greeted Chicago Deputy Mayor Steven Koch and the other 500-plus guests to an evening full of sumptuous treats. For the cocktail reception, Emirates' acclaimed cabin crew staff offered guests everything from cool hand towels to succulent traditional dates, canapes and Arabic coffee. Once the Grand Ballroom opened, guests dined on poached lobster, fillet with roasted potatoes, vegetable medley and a selection of desserts. The apex of the evening was a concert by Grammy award winning artist Lionel Ritchie.

For more information about booking a flight from Chicago to Dubai aboard Emirates' premium cabins, contact IFlyFirstClass at (888) 347-7817 or visit its website at www.iflyfirstclass.com.

Etihad Airways

Ensconced in rich, earthen tones, Etihad's luxurious first class cabins are a revelation. Frequently named the world's top first class airline by various industry groups, Etihad's reputation for superb service and posh accommodations elevates travelers' expectations and spurs its competitors. 

On board Etihad's first class, individual suites contain extra-wide seats with built-in massage functions enclosed by beautifully decorated sliding doors for the ultimate privacy. At bedtime, seats convert to 6-foot, 8-inch beds covered with fitted sheets, Dupioni silk and cotton duvets topped with full-sized pillows. Every detail is perfectly executed, from the Poltrona Frau leather upholstery to the personal minibar and wardrobes. The personal chef catering to passengers' palates, individual changing rooms, and Swarovski Elements amenity kits with La Prairie skin care products complete the mile-high posh service.

True

Lufthansa

Exceptional German innovation, engineering and precision create some of the most luscious amenities and attentive services available aboard Lufthansa's award-winning first class cabins. Forget pedestrian seats that convert to beds. Lufthansa's 747 first class cabins offer passengers a seat and a separate 77-inch-long bed. 

Passengers aboard the air carrier's new A380s enjoy extra comfort thanks to automated air humidifiers, the first of their kind in the industry. Fliers sip on wine selected by a world champion sommelier, indulge in a caviar course and dine on exquisite meals designed by some of the world's best chefs. Slumber is peaceful in Lufthansa's first class cabins, with temperature-regulating duvets, soundproof curtains and footfall sound insulation nestled beneath the first class cabin carpet.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Emirates

It should come as no surprise that the emirate that is home to extraordinary skyscrapers and some of the world's largest and most elaborate mad-made islands and shopping centers would produce one of the most uncommonly luxurious airlines. First class passengers on Dubai-based Emirates enjoy super-private suites, each outfitted with a personal minibar, vanity table, wardrobe, mirror and a plush seat that converts to a comfy flat bed. 

The pièce de résistance is the first class cabin shower spas, offering in-air hot showers, spa products, fluffy towels and a roomy marble vanity. Passengers enjoy refreshments at onboard lounges and dine in luxury on regional dishes such as stir-fried lobster in black bean sauce. And, of course, meals are served on Royal Doulton fine bone china with Robert Welch cutlery. 

With top airlines continually improving their first class services in order to meet the changing demands of upscale travelers, there are plenty of spectacular amenities and services available on today's air carriers. item.summary: Buy your business class discounted flights today. With billions of dollars invested in purchasing new aircraft and retrofitting existing airplanes over the past three years, the world's top air carriers just keep improving their business class and first class options. Increasingly, business class services are on a par with some first class, and first class seats are nearly over the top with luxurious amenities. This ever-escalating quality of business class flight offerings makes it tricky to cull out the world's best business class fares. But, we like our savvy travelers to be on top of the latest in travel news, so here's IFlyFirstClass' picks for the top 10 business class flights.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Business Class Discounted Flights

 

Buy your business class discounted flights today

With billions of dollars invested in purchasing new aircraft and retrofitting existing airplanes over the past three years, the world's top air carriers just keep improving their business class and first class options. Increasingly, business class services are on a par with some first class, and first class seats are nearly over the top with luxurious amenities. This ever-escalating quality of business class flight offerings makes it tricky to cull out the world's best business class fares. But, we like our savvy travelers to be on top of the latest in travel news, so here's IFlyFirstClass' picks for the top 10 business class flights.

At No. 10 is the often-overlooked Korean Air, with its refreshingly light cabins, exquisitely attentive service and Prestige sleeper flat beds. Travelers looking to unwind on board are delighted to find a Celestial Lounge, and those who just can't get enough of duty-free shopping can continue their browsing at the world's only in-air duty-free shop. 

Turkish Airlines understands that you can never go wrong with a pre-meal snack of Godiva chocolate and Turkish Deligh. The No. 9 business class fare includes lush amenity kits, cushy slippers, free wireless Internet, complimentary tours of Istanbul, a luscious culinary menu and comfortable lie-flat beds.

Dubai's Emirates business class is the epitome of luxury, from the incredibly spacious A380 business class cabins to chauffeur service. The No. 8 airline has made a name for itself in luxury travel circles for its sumptuous amenities, entertainment options, in-air bar and refined meal service.

Innovative Virgin Atlantic's friendly and open atmosphere rings in at No. 7 on our list. The company's long-haul business class flights offer it all: fully flat beds, privacy, on-board high-speed Internet, pajamas, large amenity kits and engaging, responsive service.

With one of the longest-held reputations for polished service and plentiful amenities, Qantas' business class seats continue to please. Lie-flat beds offer relaxing massage options, meals are palate-pleasing and personal on-demand entertainment systems help pass the time.

Privacy and service are the hallmarks of Etihad's business class fares. Lush full-flat beds, fine dining and wine pairings are in-air luxuries, matched by personal chauffeur door-to-door limousine service on the ground.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Stretch out in luxury on Oman Air's full-flat 77-and-a-half-inch beds and backrests that adjust with the touch of a button. The on-board entertainment system syncs with travelers' own devices for a full-range of entertainment options.

Qatar's business class service is pure pampering from the moment you head to the airport. Chauffeurs whisk passengers to private terminals to board the airline's fresh, new 787 Dreamliners. In-air cocktail lounges, ample work and storage space, large windows with touch control and noise-cancelling headphones make the journey a pleasurable event. 

Although at No. 2, Cathay Pacific is no slouch in the luxury arena, providing extra-long lie-flat beds with hip supports, storage cabinets, a state-of-the-art rotating library of endless entertainment and high-end cuisine. The airline is also famous for its plush business class lounges, incredibly attentive service and reasonable pricing.

At the top of our list is Singapore Airlines, where business class flights specialize in effortless luxury. Every detail is tastefully executed, from solicitous crew and sophisticated culinary service to the widest business class seat in the industry. Passengers also enjoy direct aisle access, discriminating amenity kits and extensive entertainment options.

Plenty of other airlines made our honorable mention list, as most business class fares are full of gracious services and appointments. Whether you choose to go with top-rated Singapore Airlines or our No. 10 Korean Air, sumptuous journeys await.

item.title: First Class Last Minute One Way. Top 5 Best First Class Cabins
item.summary: International air carriers continue to raise the bar for their premium first class flights, offering everything from multi-room in-air suites to personal butlers and chauffeurs. That's good news for elite travelers who can expect the competitive nature of the industry to offer increasingly opulent products and greater first class flight value. To help savvy flyers find the best first class seats in the world, IFlyFirstClass offers its selection for first class last minute one way
item.bodyColumn_1:
Need a first class last minute one way? International air carriers continue to raise the bar for their premium first class flights, offering everything from multi-room in-air suites to personal butlers and chauffeurs. That's good news for elite travelers who can expect the competitive nature of the industry to offer increasingly opulent products and greater first class flight value. To help savvy flyers find the best first class seats in the world, IFlyFirstClass offers its selection for the top five best first class cabins for 2014.

The rapid growth of Middle Eastern and Asian airlines has helped push the industry toward more lush first class accommodations, and Abu Dhabi-based Etihad is one of the leaders. Its new Residences and First Class Apartment options on the Airbus A380 put it at the top of our list. The Residence class is a three-room suite on the A380's upper deck, providing a bedroom, sitting room and en suite bathroom and shower. The Residence comes with a private butler and personal chef in the air and complimentary chauffeur service on the ground. The Apartments are also on the upper deck of the A380 and are the epitome of privacy and spacious in-air luxury. They feature a full-size vanity, a leather armchair and a sofa-ottoman that converts to a completely flat bed. Even better, the partition between two apartments can be removed to create a double bed and larger travel space for couples flying together. 

At No. 2, Singapore Airlines is no less luxurious. Its first class seats are over-sized and separate from the full-sized bed that is included in the first class suites. Sliding doors encase the suites for full privacy, and the space is filled with amenities like the KrisWorld entertainment system, Book the Cook culinary options and Dom Pérignon, all graciously supplied by the company's signature Singapore Girl service.

Always sumptuous, Cathay Pacific's first class fares are at No. 3, welcoming passengers with Krug Grand Cuvée and a host of pampering features. Dine on five-star cuisine created by the Mandarine Oriental Hotel, slip into complimentary PYE lounge wear, freshen up with an AESOP amenity kit and savor the entertainment with BOSE headphones. Supremely comfortable seats with touch-screen controls convert to equally capacious beds topped with fine bedding. The seat also offers a massage function to help passengers work out the travel kinks.
item.bodyColumn_2:
No. 4 Emirates may be topping this list next year, as they plan to debut their own full-scale suite sometime in the future. For now, their first class fares are already stellar, offering sliding-door privacy, leather reclining seats, cozy pajamas, Iranian caviar, Dom Pérignon, a vanity mirror, wardrobe, minibar and access to a shower spa. Dubai-based Emirates also offers its first class passengers complimentary limousine service.

Although not as private as some of the other first class flights on our Top 5 list, Air France's first class seats provide a breath of fresh air. Eminently stylish, the air carrier's new La Première suite presents a light and airy ambiance, clad in leather, suede and classy tweed. Seats are extra-wide and convert to a long, flat bed, and curtains can be closed to give the occupants extra privacy without feeling closed-in. A comfy ottoman/small armchair offers extra seating for companions, and a personal entertainment system is viewed on a 24-inch high definition television monitor.

item.title: First Class Plane Tickets. Etihad Reveals Luxury First Class Apartments
item.summary: We can find the best first class deals specials. Luxury living at 30,000 feet doesn't require a private, customized plane if you book first class flights aboard Etihad's newest revelation: first class apartments. Complete with a large Poltrona Frau leather armchair and a spacious ottoman/bed combination, these first class apartments will line the upper deck of Etihad's new Airbus 380 along with Etihad's luxurious residence suites and business class studios.
item.bodyColumn_1:
First Class Plane Tickets

 

We can find the best first class deals specials

Luxury living at 30,000 feet doesn't require a private, customized plane if you book first class flights aboard Etihad's newest revelation: first class apartments. Complete with a large Poltrona Frau leather armchair and a spacious ottoman/bed combination, these first class apartments will line the upper deck of Etihad's new Airbus 380 along with Etihad's luxurious residence suites and business class studios. 

Setting the Stage
Premium passengers enter the upper deck to a welcoming, upscale lobby that resembles a warm, boutique hotel entrance. Passengers proceed to their apartments down a broad, 27-inch aisle that allows passengers to pass each other comfortably. Just beyond the first class apartments, the space is filled with an inviting, full-serviced lounge area for passengers to use throughout the flight when they want to eat, drink or work in the company of others.

With a vibe that's more upscale cruise line cabin than first class seat, these apartments are completely ensconced in their own private world. Stylish sliding doors invite passengers into their apartments, where 64-inch tall walls provide luxurious privacy. The spacious 39 square foot apartment is completely free of overhead bins and bulkheads, giving passengers a roomy, open and airy space that feels as far removed from cramped flying as possible. Each apartment has one to three windows, an unheard-of feature in the industry, and ambient lighting is employed throughout the cabin to create an enticing, comfortable environment.

First Class Amenities
The custom leather-clad apartment is filled with luscious perks, from a swiveled and fully adjustable 24-inch flat screen monitor to a spacious wardrobe and a full-size lighted vanity. A chilled drinks cabinet, noise-cancelling headsets, complimentary lounge wear, total in-flight connectivity and the services of a highly trained chef ensure that first class apartment passengers luxuriate in their flight time. 

The custom leather armchair itself is a luxury, with 30 inches of breadth, pleasing recline functions and a Lantal pneumatic cushion system. And, if passengers want to freshen up during the flight, they can avail themselves of a fully equipped first class shower room.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Stretch Out and Relax
Although the apartment's extra seating/sleeping area is billed as an "ottoman," it is more like a sofa than a footstool and can seat up to three visitors for comfortable on-board socializing. The attentive turn-down service reveals that the ottoman is an 80.5-inch completely flat bed with hand-crafted, all-natural mattresses, duvets and pillows. Etihad also invested in state-of-the-art technology developed specifically for their first class apartment beds. This articulating, transverse mechanism maximizes the bed space for sleeping, stowage and socializing. The partition between two apartments can also be removed to create a comfortable double bed and extra living space for passengers traveling together.

Luxury On the Ground
As if in-air pampering isn't enough, Etihad provides complimentary chauffeur service on the ground for its first class flight passengers. And, at its home-base Abu Dhabi Airport, Etihad porters and concierges meet passengers curbside and whisk them away to a special reception area. There, passengers enjoy five-star dining, complimentary spa treatments and a score of entertainment options.

Etihad's new A380 aircraft and its first class apartments take off in December of 2014 on routes between Abu Dhabi and London Heathrow. Flights to New York, Paris, Melbourne and Sydney are expected to begin in 2015.

As a leading discount premium travel company, IFlyFirstClass always advocates using its services or a similar enterprise to find discount first class tickets. It's also the best option for saving time and energy in the hunt for first class specials. If travelers are determined to go it alone, there are a few other tips for finding the best first class airfare deals around. First, travelers should be flexible on the day and time of their flights. Red-eyes may be uncomfortable in coach class, but with a comfy first class seat and bed, the flight may be much more restful, especially if there's savings to be had. Similarly, the day of the week can make a difference. Travel on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Saturdays is less in demand, so bargain first class flights may be more available on those days.

One of the happiest and least dependable ways to find cheap first class fares is to hope for a first class upgrade on your coach or business class ticket. There are several ways to make a complimentary upgrade more likely. Joining airline loyalty programs, a willingness to be bumped to another flight and checking in first for your flight may provide better chances for upgrades, but there's never a guarantee.
item.bodyColumn_2:

There are many knowledgeable travelers and agents on sites like FlyerTalk who can help guide travelers on finding great first class deals.

Accruing travel points with travel rewards credit cards, airline cards and hotel cards are great ways to lessen the cost of a first class flight. All flights and points systems are not created equally, though, so travelers should do a little online research before trying to redeem their points. Checking with websites devoted to helping travelers get the most value for their travel points can really pay off in the long-run. 

Flying first class can be a luxurious, satisfying experience, but only if you're not spending the flight time worrying about how much you spent on those coveted first class tickets. item.title: Cheap One Way Business Class Airline Tickets - IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: Searching for business class cheap one way fairs? Competition in the luxury travel industry is sharpening, leading to more opulent business class services and cutting-edge amenities. As the number of business class seats expand and competition deepens, travelers benefit with more amazing flight options and better business class deals. But, finding those deals takes skill and know-how, and who better to provide those tips than the discount premium travel service IFlyFirstClass?
item.bodyColumn_1:
Cheap One Way Business Class

 

Searching for business class cheap one way fairs?

Competition in the luxury travel industry is sharpening, leading to more opulent business class services and cutting-edge amenities. As the number of business class seats expand and competition deepens, travelers benefit with more amazing flight options and better business class deals. But, finding those deals takes skill and know-how, and who better to provide those tips than the discount premium travel service IFlyFirstClass?

TO help would-be jet-setters find the best discount business class fares, IFlyFirstClass offers these tips of the trade:

1. Choose timing wisely. Flights on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Saturdays are generally less busy so they are more likely to offer better pricing. Travelers looking for business class bargains should also be willing to fly at any time of day or night in order to get the best prices. And, selecting seasons that are less popular for business travelers may also pay off. For example, many European businesses take a holiday during the month of August. As a result, there may be excess available business class tickets to European destinations during that time, leading to better discounts.

2. Choose regional airports. In the competitive air travel business, smaller airports edge out their rivals by providing lower costs to airlines that sometimes trickle down as lower costs for travelers. If you're flying out of San Francisco, for instance, check rates on the same airlines flying out of nearby airports like San Jose and Oakland. 

3. Rack up the points. Sign up for airline clubs that reward members for flying with the company to increase your chances of being upgraded to business class. And, be sure to check out some of the top travel rewards credit cards that provide consumers with points. These points can be redeemed for a variety of travel products, including business class seats. Just keep in mind that these credit cards are only a good deal if you are able to pay off the balance each month, they transfer points to airlines you want to use and the restrictions are not too limiting. Also, beware of costly annual fees and potential points transfer fees.
item.bodyColumn_2:
4. Become an expert on premium travel. A variety of websites provide information on how to redeem points for maximum value and how to find better discounted business class flights. FlyerTalk teems with travel experts and site posters who have a wealth of knowledge in how to work the fare and points systems to your advantage.

5. Use the experts. By far, the easiest way to find cheap business class fares is to use the services of a travel agency that specializes in discounted business class seats. They work day-in and day-out with the airlines so they are always on top of the latest business class deals and fare reductions. Best of all, using a service like IFlyFirstClass simply takes a quick phone call or website nudge to get the ball rolling on your next discounted business class flight.

Whether you're a die-hard do-it-yourselfer or you just want someone else to do the research and booking for you, flying business class is a delicious luxury. item.title: One Way Discounted Business Class. Popular Winter Destinations
item.summary: From lush ski resorts and storybook winter festivals to tropical paradises, there are plenty of one way discounted business class seats for wintertime holidays. Whether travelers want to jet on cheap first class flights to snow-filled resorts or plan to take a discounted business class fare to escape the chill of winter, here are some of the top international winter destinations.
item.bodyColumn_1:
From lush ski resorts and storybook winter festivals to tropical paradises, there are plenty of one way discounted business class seats for wintertime holidays. Whether travelers want to jet on cheap first class flights to snow-filled resorts or plan to take a discounted business class fare to escape the chill of winter, here are some of the top international winter destinations.

Those in the winter-loving camp savor the sights, sounds, aromas and spirit of the season, flocking to some of Europe's most beloved Christmas markets and ski resorts. Beautiful Stuttgart, Germany, is the place to go for an appealing traditional Christmas market. The market dates back to 1692 and features hundreds of illuminations, exhilarating concerts and nearly 300 craft and food stalls with plenty of traditional Black Forest delights. 

Also a Christmastime favorite, Salzburg, Austria, is famous as the birthplace of "Silent Night." Visitors revel in the city's enticing and varied Christmas markets. And, they delight in the moving, once-in-a-lifetime experience found at the Obendorf chapel site that started it all.

For skiing, ice skating and other winter activities, La Plagne, France, is the top destination. Named the world's most popular ski destination in the 2014 International Report on Snow and Mountain Tourism, La Plagne hosts about 2.5 million visitors each year. The resort town offers everything from downhill skiing and spa services to bobsledding and ice climbing. Tucked into the captivating French Alps, La Plagne and its brethren Alpine ski resorts attract 45 percent of all ski travelers, making the entire region a flurry of winter activity.

Ottowa, Canada, embraces a variety of other treasured winter traditions, including its Winterlude festival that is one of the largest in the world. Ice sculptures, a 4.8-mile ice "skateway" and lively outdoor concerts are just a few of the city's thrilling winter offerings.

Those who want a little surf and sun for their winter holiday head for more tropical destinations aboard luxuriously discounted first class flights and business class fares. Traditionally, sun lovers have flocked to Thailand's warm beaches and turquoise waves, but Vietnam's Phu Quoc Island is quickly becoming a favorite. Reef diving, secluded beaches and gorgeous waterfalls are the perfect antidote to chilly North American climates.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Mexico's Cabo San Lucas continues to attract sun-seekers looking for a rousing beach vacation. Sun-seekers adore Cabo in the winter for its fascinating scuba diving, chic nightlife, sleek resorts and plush golf courses. In winter, the warm climate provides days in the high 70s and low 80s, comfortable evenings in the mid-50s to 60s and the perfect conditions for a warm, fun-filled holiday.

Other sun-seekers prefer the colorful islands of the Caribbean for their winter escape from workplace responsibilities. Since hurricane season traditionally ends November 30, winter is the ideal time to experience all of the Caribbean's uniquely captivating sights and flavors. Whether flying in affordable first class to Puerto Rico or luxuriating in spacious business class seats en route to St. Martin, the Caribbean islands are the ideal vacation. There, visitors can explore history and culture, relax on the beach, scuba dive, swim and enjoy the balmy weather and tropical landscapes.

From sunshine and palm trees to snow-capped mountains and pines, the world offers a bounty of beautiful winter escapes. And, there's no better way to begin a brilliant winter interlude than with a luxuriously cheap first class flight.
