item.title: Book Cheap Business First Class Fares | IFlyFirstClass
item.summary: Knowing when to book a cheap business first class fares to get the best deals in business class can be tricky. Recent news reports tout that the ideal time to find cheap business class flights and first class deals is 54 days in advance, but that oversimplification may lead bargain hunters down the wrong path. Travelers searching for the biggest savings need a bit more knowledge and savvy to really score the best deals, particularly when it comes to booking business class to Europe and other international destinations.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Business Class Fares

 

Knowing when to book a cheap business first class fares to get the best deals in business class can be tricky. Recent news reports tout that the ideal time to find cheap business class flights and first class deals is 54 days in advance, but that oversimplification may lead bargain hunters down the wrong path. Travelers searching for the biggest savings need a bit more knowledge and savvy to really score the best deals, particularly when it comes to booking business class to Europe and other international destinations. 

First, some general guidelines will help in the hunt for cheap first class tickets and business class flights. For international destinations, most cheap business class and first class airfare deals are found about 60 days before the intended flight. But, there are some caveats with that rule: watch out for big holidays, peak seasons and special global events like the Olympics and the World Cup that place high demand on tickets. After all, the higher the demand, the higher the price airlines place on fares.

Business class specials and cheap first class prices also vary by continent, complicating the search. For instance, business class to Europe usually offers the best flight deals about 151 days before the scheduled flight. As a result, travel aboard business class to London and first class to Frankfurt generally should be booked more than five months in advance. But, that rule is thrown out the door when high-demand summer travel is concerned. A recent study of prices found that summer flights to Europe should be booked 319 days in advance, nearly a full year prior to travel.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Travelers shouldn't despair, though, because those same market forces can work to their advantage when demand is low. For example, first class specials and cheap business class flights to Asia are more readily available 129 days in advance. But, some Asian countries like South Korea experience their off-peak season from January to April, so first class to Seoul may be a steal just two months in advance. Similarly, globetrotters flying business class to Hong Kong in winter months may find terrific deals as long as they avoid the late-January/early Feburary festival and holiday season.

It's also helpful to know when the demand is great for economy and coach seats but low for premium seats. That can be the case during some of the biggest summer travel months in Europe when pleasure travelers flock to coach, not knowing that cheap business class prices may offer more value.

In the end, finding the most deeply discounted business class seats and first class fares takes a fair amount of skill, knowledge and ingenuity. Unfortunately, many travelers don’t have the luxury of extended lead times or the in-depth knowledge of a country’s holidays, special events and peak seasons to find the most discounted business class tickets and cheap first class flights. That's where discount premium travel experts come in handy. Services like IFlyFirstClass specialize in finding the most inexpensive first and business class flights, drawing on years of experience to know where, when and how to find bargain premium flights. That gives travelers the advantage of cheap premium flights without the hassle of picking just the right time to book a flight abroad.

The news just gets better for savvy travelers looking for cheap first class tickets and discounted business class flights. Already, announcements of new mega-luscious first class apartment suites and dozens of other sumptuous first and business class amenities were the talk of the industry. And now, a recent report by aviation data company OAG reveals a whopping 34 percent increase in the number of first class seats on 2014 flights. 

This greater number of seats will eventually translate into greater availability and more first class airfare deals on seats that remain unsold. Best deals on one way tickets. This puts to bed the notion that luxury travel was dying, an argument that seemed to be supported when American Airlines announced it was eliminating first class seating on its long-haul Boeing 777-200s.

Unsurprisingly, the greatest first class seat growth is found on Middle Eastern and Chinese aircraft that serve the regions' growing economies. In 2005, 8.6 million first class seats were available in Asia. In 2014, that number jumped to 26.7 million. Air China added 63 percent to its first class seating between 2009 and 2014, and China Eastern gained a full 123 percent over the same time period. And while many of these luxurious seats come with equally sumptuous price tags, their proliferation ultimately means cheap first class prices for those who know where to look for the bargains. So, travelers who are searching for discounted first class to Seoul or cheap first class seats to Hong Kong may have a better chance of finding a bargain in today's market.

Even in markets like Europe and the Americas where first class capacity is down, the prospects for cheap business class flights remain strong. For instance, although American Airlines is eliminating its first class seating on international flights, it's doing so to increase the number of business class seats that lie fully flat. As a result, flyers can expect more luxury, whether they're flying business class to London, business class to Hong Kong or business class to Europe. Even better, when a number of these business class flights aren't filled to capacity, the opportunities for cheap business class tickets and system-wide business class specials abound.

In spite of all these positive developments in both first and business class flights, the secret to scoring the best deals business class and first class have to offer remains complicated. item.title: All You Want to Know About Airports
item.summary: When you're searching for cheap first class prices and discounted business class fares, choosing the right departure airport is just as important as selecting flight schedules, low prices and premium cabins that fit your needs. Flying from a disorganized, complicated airport can lead to unexpected delays, lengthy security lines, missed or canceled flights, lost baggage and a host of other mishaps that can cost you money. And, you definitely don't want to erase all the savings you achieved with your cheap first class tickets and best deals in business class with those unexpected expenses.
item.bodyColumn_1:
When you're searching for cheap first class prices and discounted business class fares, choosing the right departure airport is just as important as selecting flight schedules, low prices and premium cabins that fit your needs. Flying from a disorganized, complicated airport can lead to unexpected delays, lengthy security lines, missed or canceled flights, lost baggage and a host of other mishaps that can cost you money.Last minute business class to London.  And, you definitely don't want to erase all the savings you achieved with your cheap first class tickets and best deals in business class with those unexpected expenses.

When choosing a departure airport, travelers might want to consult Businessweek's recently released Airport Frustration Index. The index lists North America's most and least irritating airports based on the feedback from 3,000 frequent fliers, on-time performance statistics and other data. Unfortunately, some of the airports that are popular East Coast departure points for business class to London, first class to Seoul and business class to Hong Kong are some of the continent's most frustrating airports. The top offender was New York's LaGuardia Airport, followed by Newark Liberty International, Washington Dulles, Chicago O'Hare and New York's JFK.

Some of the middle-ranking airports received mixed reviews, offering some good points like quick drive times to the airport along with some downsides like long security lines. As alternatives to the most frustrating airports, these might offer some advantages but they may not be your first choice if you're looking beyond only cheap first class fares or cheap business class prices. Some of these moderately frustrating airports include San Francisco, Denver, Charlotte Douglas, Boston Logan and Ronald Reagan National.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Luckily, the news isn't all bad. Several popular airports achieved acclaim as the least frustrating airports, and they often provide first class specials and cheap business class flights. Vancouver International topped this least frustrating list, followed by Portland Oregon, Austin-Bergstrom, Calgary, Phoneix, Tampa and Seattle-Tacoma. They all rated well with restroom cleanliness, efficient security lines and ample shopping. With this information in mind, savvy fliers who want first class airfare deals, business class to Asia or reduced business class to Europe might want to consider some of these less frustrating airports. 

Of course, when you're looking for cheap business class tickets and first class deals, it may be easier to turn the whole matter over to travel services that specialize in finding discounted premium flights. Plus, they're in better positions to find deals on those normally costly itineraries like last minute flights and one way business class fares.

Booking first and business class flights that fit your schedule, budget and convenience is tough enough without adding in a challenging departure airport. Taking a few minutes to glance at reports like Businessweeks' Airport Frustration Index helps you provide important information to your travel schedulers so they can find the deals you need at airports you prefer.

An Adventure in Wizardry

Then head back into the city for a stop at Kings Cross Station to have a picture taken at Platform 9 3/4. Check out the the train station facade at St. Pancras Station, Diagon Alley's film site at Leadenhall Market and walk through Picadilly Circus as Ron, Hermione and Harry did in "Deathly Hallows."

item.summary: A journey to Middle Earth, or at least the movie version of it, whisks travelers away to the gorgeous scenery and welcoming culture of New Zealand. For savvy travelers who are looking to begin and end their excursion to New Zealand in the lap of luxury, there are plenty of cheap business class flights and first class airfare deals to sweeten the trip.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Business Class to New Zealand

 

A journey to Middle Earth, or at least the movie version of it, whisks travelers away to the gorgeous scenery and welcoming culture of New Zealand. For savvy travelers who are looking to begin and end their excursion to New Zealand in the lap of luxury, there are plenty of cheap business class flights and first class airfare deals to sweeten the trip.

The Journey, Part One
After you've scored the best deals business class has to offer or you've found dreamy cheap first class fares, book your trip to start at Aukland Airport. Aukland's location on the North Island is the perfect jumping off point for a variety of adventures, including those that involve the "Hobbit." While driving to some of the sites allows you to experience more the country's culture and attractions, some of the area's tours are able to access privately-operated locations. Whether you choose to go it alone or join a group, "Hobbit" fans are sure to be captivated.

Travel first to PioPio, about two and-a-half hours south of Aukland. Its massive limestone rocks and scenery make up the Denize Bluffs and were the site of Trollshaw forest and Staddle Farm. It is here that Gandalf gave the sword "Sting" to Bilbao and the Orcs and Wargs attacked.

Once you've relished all of the campfire and troll scene locales, continue on to Matamata. There, you'll find the life-sized hobbit holes of Hobbiton, see Bilbo Baggins' home and dine at the Green Dragon Inn. From Matamata, travelers may continue driving south or return to Aukland to take a luxuriously cheap first class flight or discounted business class fare to bustling Wellington. 

The Journey, Part Two
Wellington's airport is one of the best airports in Australasia and features a 43-foot long Gollum sculpture suspended from the airport rafters. Wellington itself is home to the "Hobbit's" soundstage and lot at Stone Street Studios.
item.bodyColumn_2:
From Wellington, it's a four-hour trip north to Turoa, the entrance to The Lonely Mountain site. On one side of the mountainous area is Hidden Bay, used for the scene where Gollum scampered along the river chasing fish. The other side is home to Tongariro Park's volcanic region, used for Mordor's home and Mt. Doom.

The Journey, Part Three
Then, it's back to Wellington for more comfortable and cheap business class flights to the South Island. While on the South Island, check out the Pelorus River, the setting of the Misty Mountains and the turquoise Lake Pukaki's setting as Laketown.

Of course, there are dozens of other sites throughout the country that served as backdrops and scenes from the "Hobbit" trilogy, and saving money with cheap first class tickets or discounted business class tickets can help you explore them all. If searching for bargain premium travel is proving to be your own personal drama, use a service like IFlyFirstClass that specializes in finding business class specials and first class deals that save you hundreds of dollars. item.summary: Majestic, poignant and historic, much of the world's history is tied up in some of its most beloved clock towers. Travelers can skip the predictable itineraries by creating an unusual journey exploring the world's massive clocks and the architectural, technological and cultural triumphs they represent. Five clock towers are our favorites, some for their history, some for their grand scale and some for the message of hope and peace they protray. Travelers can even fly to these clock towers in style with cheap business class flights and first class specials.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Best One Way Business Class Fares

 

Majestic, poignant and historic, much of the world's history is tied up in some of its most beloved clock towers. Travelers can skip the predictable itineraries by creating an unusual journey exploring the world's massive clocks and the architectural, technological and cultural triumphs they represent. Five clock towers are our favorites, some for their history, some for their grand scale and some for the message of hope and peace they protray. Travelers can even fly to these clock towers in style with cheap business class flights and first class specials.

Big Ben, London
Gorgeous Elizabeth Tower is home to the legendary 13-ton Big Ben bell and Great Westminster Clock, the world's largest four-faced chiming clock. The 1859 neo-Gothic clock features dials that are nearly 30 feet in diameter and two-foot tall numerals. During World War II blitzes of London, the bell continued chiming, reassuring the community that London still stood. Summer is high season in London, so travelers will more easily find cheap first class tickets and business class to London in the fall, winter and spring.

Rathaus-Glockenspiel, Munich
Housed in the neo-Gothic New Town Hall, the Glockenspiel is located in the balcony of the tower. Chiming at 11 o'clock each day, the two-tier display reenacts some of the city's cultural touchpoints in a 12-minute spectacle with finely carved figurines: the marriage of Duke Wilhelm V, its celebratory joust and the cooper's dance, Schäfflertanz. As with most European destinations, summer is peak season in Munich, so cheap first class prices and the best deals on business class to Europe are found from March to May and September to November.

Makkah Royal Clock Tower, Mecca
The world's largest clock face is located in the heart of Saudi Arabia's Mecca. At 1,833 feet tall, it's also the tallest clock tower on earth. An observation deck at the clock's base provides a unique viewing experience, and the building itself houses a hotel, residences, an Islamic museum and a lunar observatory. The best time to find cheap business class tickets and first class deals to the Holy City are from November to January.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Twin Clock Tower, Seoul
A powerful element of the War Memorial of Korea, the Twin Clock Tower isn't the traditional tower. Depicting the never-ending struggle between North and South, the two clocks are held by statues of young girls. One clock displays the day and hour that war began between South Korea and North Korea. The other clock is blank, awaiting the time it can display the day and hour Korea is reunified. Low and shoulder seasons for Seoul are May to June and September to December, so those are terrific times to find cheap business class to Asia and especially cheap first class to Seoul

Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong
Standing 144 feet tall, Hong Kong's Clock Tower is a local favorite and an enticing attraction to visitors. Now resting at the base of Salisbury Road next to the ferry pier, the clock tower was a symbol of hope and welcome to millions of Chinese immigrants. It has operated nearly ceaselessly since its creation in 1921, but it did not run during the World War II Japanese occupation of Hong Kong. Discounted business class to Hong Kong and first class airfare deals are abundant year-round, but are most easily found in winter and summer.

There is hope for travelers who would rather spend their time enjoying their destinations than searching for discounted business class tickets and first class deals. IFlyFirstClass specializes in offering the best deals business class has to offer as well as cheap first class fares to dozens of international destinations and clock towers.

item.title: Singing the Praises of International Art Festivals
item.summary: Whether you're dancing the flamenco in Spain or the Korean court dance of jeongjaemu, relishing a country's music, dance and art is a terrific way to enrich your travels
item.bodyColumn_1:
Whether you're dancing the flamenco in Spain or the Korean court dance of jeongjaemu, relishing a country's music, dance and art is a terrific way to enrich your travels. For an even more spectacular experience, combine visits to some of the world's most thrilling arts festivals with luxury business class flights and first class specials that will deliver you to your destination in relaxing style. 

Hong Kong Arts Festival
For more than 40 years, opera, theater, dance and music artists from around the world have converged in Hong Kong in February and March for the major arts festival. With more than 150 performances and more than 250 events held throughout the city, there's never a dull moment. February can be a high-demand travel month to Hong Kong, so enlist the help of a premium travel service like IFlyFirstClass to find cheap first class and business class to Hong Kong.

Brighton Festival
During the first three weeks of May, the UK celebrates one of its largest mixed arts festivals. Theatrical, circus and dance performances are just the beginning of the jubilant delights. Film, art, debate and family events are also held throughout the region, giving visitors and residents plenty of opportunity to savor the festival's sights and rhythms. Brighton is just 40 miles from the Smoke, so take advantage of off-season's plentiful cheap first class prices and discounted business class to London for a luxurious journey to England. 

Granada International Festival of Dance and Music 
Spain pulls out all the stops for its annual arts festival, with the dramatic Alhambra as one of its main venues. The city has a long history of exalting music and dance, beginning with its concerts held at King Carlos V Palace since 1883. The festival's performances and community events are usually offered from late June through early July, which can be a popular travel season. Fortunately, many travelers during this time are looking for economy flights, so it is possible to find first class deals and bargains on business class to Europe.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Hi Seoul Festival
Street art meets dance and performance art in one of Seoul's premier international art festivals each October. Events are held in the city's major plazas, encouraging visitors to interact with locals in a comfortable, welcoming atmosphere. Autumn months in Seoul are generally good travel times, since summer's heat and humidity have passed. There are often cheap business class flights to the city as well as stellar prices on first class to Seoul. Festival-goers might also consider traveling to nearby countries like China and Japan for an extended tour of the continent before heading to Seoul for the rousing festival. It's not peak travel season, so finding cheap business class to Asia or other excellent one way business class fares to the region should be relatively simple.

IFlyFirstClass specializes in finding outstanding cheap first class tickets and discounted business class fares for travelers looking for exciting new international experiences. These first class airfare deals and cheap business class prices save travelers hundreds of dollars, leaving plenty of budget available to explore more festivals and events.

item.title: Yachting Adventures Around the World. Cheap Business & First Class Flights.

item.bodyColumn_1:
Champagne on a sun-drenched deck, pampering staff, one-of-a-kind views of exotic landscapes and the freedom to travel at your own pace are just a few of the benefits of sailing international seas on a luxury yacht. Hundreds of super yachts and mega yachts are available around the world, offering endlessly sumptuous options for travel. Whether you're cruising the Mediterranean or the Han River, you can start and end your journey in that same exquisite style with business class specials and first class airfare deals to your launching site. Seoul
The sleek, modern Seoul Marina Club & Yacht is the perfect launching point for a lush experience on the Han River. Even if you're in Seoul for business, an evening sail to entertain clients or a relaxing weekend adventure is just the ticket. The marina offers a variety of yacht charters to fit any schedule and preference, all giving visitors a stellar view of glittering Seoul. The yacht club also offers reciprocal berthing opportunities at a variety of other marinas, including Nansha Marina in Guangdong, China. Of course, getting to South Korea in comfort is at least half the fun when you find cheap first class to Seoul or other amazingly cheap business class to Asia.

Hong Kong
Victoria Harbor is already an exciting destination, but add in a day on a posh yacht, and you have an unforgettable experience. The area's numerous yacht companies provide magnificent options, including a 78-foot Numarine and a chic 55-foot Sunseeker Blackjack. Destinations are equally diverse. Wander the region's many bays in search of the perfect beach, take an evening sail around the harbor to see Hong Kong's dazzling light shows, or cruise the many South China Sea islands and berth in Macau. There are plentiful and cheap business class flights and first class specials to the region, so smart globetrotters can save hundreds of dollars while enjoying a top-of-the-line excursion. London

And to continue that over-the-top experience, be sure to take advantage of cheap first class and business class to London. item.title: Affordable First Class to Australia: Shaking Away the Winter Blues in Australia
item.summary: Ice-covered streets and snow-filled driveways are a distant memory the minute you bought two first class tickets to Australia. Instead of thick, down-filled coats, winter visitors can don skin-baring bathing suits, floppy beach hats instead of knit ski caps and flip flops instead of fur-lined boots. Here, umbrellas are purely to protect tender winter skin from the bright Australian sun and warm summer rain showers.
item.bodyColumn_1:
More than 300,000 North Americans have already discovered the joy of wintering in Australia, and that number is growing each year. Don’t worry about crowds though. With 10,685 beaches spanning more than 29,200 miles of coastline and 4.3 million square miles of land, there’s plenty of space to provide you with the luxury winter escape of your dreams. Whether you prefer visiting world-class cities, resting in lush mountain retreats or sunning yourself in exclusive island resorts, Australia is the ideal place to find respite from chilly North American winters. So buy your first class tickets to Australia today! 

Qualia, Great Barrier Reef
Boat or fly into Hamilton Island’s Qualia resort, and you’re immediately ensconced in the private seaside retreat’s pampering delights. The Latin word qualia translates to “a collection of deeper sensory experiences.” Qualia retreat prides itself on catering to all the senses with exclusive spa services, seven-course meals, incredible views and customized tours and activities. The boutique property’s 60 private pavilions are distinctively designed, spread across 30 tropical acres surrounding the Coral Sea. The inviting pavilions are made of gleaming indigenous wood and stone, complimenting glass walls that overlook the water and the other scenic Whitsunday Islands. 

For those who want to venture out of the resort, guests are given use of a private VIP chauffeur service or a golf cart for more self-directed exploration. Guests can be flown via helicopter to neighboring Dent Island for lunch or a round of golf at the treasured Hamilton Island Golf Club, or you can take the resort’s luxury 45-foot yacht for a sunset sail along the Coral Sea. Guests enjoy snorkeling, scuba diving and sightseeing trips to the Great Barrier Reef, and resort staff is happy to coordinate trips to see the reef from a seaplane.

Personalized concierge services ensure that your every whim is satisfied. Well-being classes in yoga and core strengthening are offered daily, and guests can participate in weekly sunset yoga classes at the nearby Hamilton Island Yacht Club. Pampering massage sessions and enriching meditation classes at the resort’s day spa keep guests relaxed throughout their Qualia visit.

Hamilton Island itself is a popular post-Christmas vacation site with ample family-friendly activities for visitors of all ages. The average high temperature from January to March is a warm 86 degrees, perfect for exploring the retreat’s beach activities.


Longitude 131°, Ayers Rock
Set in the middle of Australia’s massive desert, Longitude 131° offers a luxury experience like no other. Giving guests the illusion of camping, the resort’s 15 private “tent” pavilions are perched atop the dunes overlooking the iconic Uluru, or Ayers Rock. Posh, supple furnishings outfit the pavilions, from high-end linens on king size beds to iPads and wireless internet. You won’t want spend much time looking for modern, electronic entertainment, though, with Australia’s captivating bush surrounding you. Each private pavilion features a glass wall for daytime views of majestic Uluru and nighttime stargazing. 

In fact, the term “starry night” takes on a whole new meaning here in Australia’s Red Centre. After dining in the luscious Dune House restaurant, you can gaze upon the Southern Cross and the Milky Way while the resort’s astronomer shares local creation stories influenced by the stars. 

Even though the resort’s night-time activities are fascinating, you’ll also relish starting your day early. Guided sunrise walks around the magnificent Uluru are once-in-a-lifetime experiences, and they’ll give you a chance to see the way lighting variations change the color of the magnificent monolith. The resort also offers bespoke experiences, from hikes through the Valley of the Winds to flights over picturesque Mount Connor. Guests can ride a camel through the outback, drive a Harley Davidson’s around Uluru or take a private guided tour of the region. 

Visiting the outback from December to March is best suited to those who revel in very warm days. The average daytime high is about 96 degrees. Each pavilion is climate controlled and designed to stay cool during hot Australian summer days, though, so you can choose to stay indoors during the hottest hours of the day. 



The Byron at Byron Resort & Spa, Byron Bay
If you’ve ever longed for a rainforest retreat, The Byron is your kind of resort. The subtropical rainforest locale gives the resort its exotic setting, but the resort’s lush accommodations, indulgent staff and chic architecture give The Byron its idyllic ambiance. Ninety-two one-bedroom suites are spread among the resort’s 45 acres, offering the perfect blend of privacy and society. 

You’ll want to spend the day admiring the rainforest from the pool area and the resort’s spacious wooden verandas, but be sure to fit in time to enjoy the resort’s other attractions. Wander down to Tallow Beach along the resort’s rainforest boardwalk, relax with a daily yoga class, tour a farmer’s market with the resort’s head chef or spend the day being pampered in the spa. Tennis courts, a fitness center and a sauna round out some of the resort’s most popular offerings.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Daredevil guests prize nearby Byron Bay’s skydiving, hang gliding and wind surfing options, while those looking for a different sort of breathtaking activity enjoy kayaking, snorkeling and riding horses along the beach.

Dining at The Byron is just as superb as the resort’s setting and accommodations. Here, seasonal menus feature innovative dishes made with locally produced ingredients. You can delight in more stellar rainforest views from the elegant dining room while enjoying drinks from a palate-pleasing wine and cocktail list.

Byron Bay’s weather from December to March is just about perfect for North American residents trying to escape winter’s freezing temperatures. Daily highs average around 80 degrees, cooling down in the evening with rainforest showers.


Crown Towers, Melbourne
Urban sophistication is the hallmark of the Crown Towers resort in the heart of Melbourne. Views of the Yarra River are just as breathtaking as the hotel’s luxury interior that features contemporary furnishings with a touch of 1930s Hollywood glamour. The Crown Towers has everything you want as a cultivated world traveler: a sumptuous spa, a tony casino, dynamic nightclubs and exquisite shopping. While you’ll never have to leave the tower, the hotel’s Southbank location puts you in the perfect location to enjoy river cruises and visits to the Melbourne Aquarium, museums and dozens of other refined restaurants, shops and cultural activities. 

The Crown Towers’ svelte rooms and suites offer all of the top conveniences of other five-star hotels, including spacious marble vanities, dressing rooms, fine linens and stunning views of the vibrant city, the Yarra River or Port Phillip Bay. Executive and Premier Club guests enjoy suites with abundant amenities, expansive space and floor-to-ceiling windows that make the most of panoramic views.

The Crown Spa is equally luxurious, offering spa and salon services such as therapeutic massages, rejuvenating facials, body treatments and specialized spa services for men. After a relaxing massage, you can head to the spa’s Aqua Retreat, where you can take a therapeutic rain shower, indulge in the vitality pool or restore yourself in the hammam. Renowned cosmetic surgeon Dr. Tass also operates his cosmetic enhancement clinic on site.


Lilianfels Resort & Spa, Blue Mountains
Australia’s legendary Blue Mountains are spectacular, and the Lilianfels Resort is the perfect vantage point for taking in the region’s splendor. The cliff-side boutique resort features 85 rooms with awe-inspiring views of the Jamison Valley and the Blue Mountains’ stunning Three Sisters rock formation. Lilianfels is the only five-star resort in the region, and the staff takes special care to preserve that status by offering knowledgeable concierges, round-the-clock reception and pampering staff.

As you would expect from a five-star resort, Lilianfels’ accommodations are top-notch. Furnishings are traditional and elegant; rooms are spacious; and service is attentive. The award-winning Darley’s restaurant is just one of the resort’s dining options, providing fine dining to complement the resort’s contemporary Echoes Restaurant and more casual The Orangery. Of course, you can also stay in your room and order in food from an extensive menu of healthy and indulgent dishes. Take to the resort’s 24-hour fitness center, indoor and outdoor pool, tennis courts or sauna, and you may even feel justified in treating yourself to some of resort’s special high tea confections. 

After a rousing day exploring the World Heritage Blue Mountains, relax with one of the on-site spa’s therapeutic treatments. Menu options range from hand and foot treatments and facials to massages and traditional Turkish scrubs.

While the weather isn’t as warm in Lilianfels’ town of Katoomba as it is in other parts of Australia, daytime highs from December to March are comfortable in the low 70s. Those seeking an afternoon or two of beach weather can take a quick 90-minute drive to Sydney where temperatures are slightly warmer and the beaches are plentiful.

item.title: Cheap Business Class Flights Deals : Discovering Adelaide's Treasures
item.summary: Planning a trip to Adelaide - save on our deals on Business and First Class flights to Australia. Enjoy both great savings and comfortable luxury flight when you travel to Adelaide, Australia. Call Us Now 888-347-7817.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Discovering Adelaide's Treasures

Adelaide's reputation as a low-key, unassuming city leads many travelers to make the mistake of overlooking Adelaide's many delights. The city is actually very cosmopolitan, preferring to show its style with a European sensibility of quality, understated elegance and openness. Charming Adelaide differentiates itself from other metropolitan areas with beautifully preserved buildings, ample green spaces and inviting public landscapes. If you are already interested in traveling to Adelaide - get your discounted business class flights and save. 

The pleasing architecture and city design is just part of Adelaide's considerable appeal, and with a large number of local multi-millionaires, Adelaide sports plenty of attractions for high-end travelers. Here are some of our favorites:

Dine in Style, Inside and Outside the City
A town that produces the refined, decadent flavor of Haigh's Chocolates is sure to have other edible delights just waiting to be sampled, and Adelaide's food scene does not disappoint. Many of the city's best-known restaurants line colorful Gouger Street, from Concubine Chinese Restaurant and the Indian fare of The Thali Room to the seafood-rich Loft Oyster and Wine Bar. Outlying areas are equally worth exploring, including the swanky suburb of Belair where Windy Point's dishes earn many accolades. Also just outside the city, Magill Estate Restaurant's incredible views of the foothills and surrounding vineyards complement its contemporary and fresh cuisine and extensive Penfolds wines.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Enjoying a Luxury Itinerary and the most affrodable business class flight
Adelaide is surrounded by incredible landscapes. These features provide enticing recreation and sports that are just as perfect for adventure-seekers as they are for more relaxed travelers. Kayaking the Torren River and picturesque mangroves, sailing the bay and touring the Barossa Valley wineries can be as luxurious or as low-key as you want. If you plan to visit the region often or have business contacts in the area, renting an Adelaide Oval corporate suite for the season is a great way to make a big splash. Suite-holders enjoy a year's worth of cricket and football games and have preferential booking for the venue's rugby games, Test Matches and concerts as well as access to the Audi Stadium Club. The Art Gallery of South Australia, the Botanic Gardens, the South Australia Museum and the State Theatre Company are also worth a visit and give visitors an opportunity to connect with like-minded travelers and locals.

Living in Luxury, flying last minute business class to Adelaide
Spectacular river views and sumptuous rooms are the hallmark of the InterContinental Adelaide. The hotel is one of Adelaide's few towers, offering executive suites and floors, private limousines and secretarial services to guests. Chic Clarion Hotel Soho dazzles with a roof-top pool, Soho Spa and fine dining. Just outside of the city in the Adelaide Hills, the Thorngrove Manor Hotel is full of Old World charm and is a unique way to luxuriously experience South Australia. For breathtaking ocean scenery, nearby Kangaroo Island's Southern Ocean Lodge blends lush guest suites and personalized service with views of the bay and grazing kangaroos.

Picking Up a Few Trinkets Along the Way
Adelaide is much more oriented to its festivals, recreation and cultural treasures than its retail establishments, but its posh shopping scene continues to grow. While in town, don't miss a visit to Tiffany & Co., Oroton, Colette Hayman, David Jones and Max Mara along the welcoming North Terrace.

item.title: Save on Business Class Airfare . Enjoy Top Four Resorts in Singapore
item.summary: With a stunning Malay Peninsula location and countless chic hotels, restaurants and boutiques, it’s easy to see why those who want a luxury experience head to gorgeous Singapore.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The city of 157,000 millionaires and 22 billionaires is abuzz with luxury, offering dozens of elite hotels. Todya, you have a chance to save big on business class airfare to Singapore. Here are four of our favorites:

W Singapore - Sentosa Cove
Stunning Sentosa Island is known for its many attractions, from the chic Quayside Isle dining and shopping destination to fabulous beaches. The W Hotel puts you in the heart of the action with all of the trademark W touches: colorful furnishings, attentive staff and amenities that help guests make the most of the unique location. Arrive in style aboard your yacht by taking advantage of the hotel’s private marina berths, and float your troubles away in the 1,338-square-meter lagoon pool. A DJ keeps you entertained on the pool deck. If you feel like taking a dip into the pool, you'll still be able to rock out while swimming since the music is also piped underwater. A variety of sumptuous suites are available for guests, some with terrace pools and other over-the-top amenities.

Marina Bay Sands
Even among a city of posh towers, the Marina Bay Sands Resort is an iconic landmark. Its three towers are connected atop the 57th level with the stunning three-acre Sky Park. There, you can swim and play in the Sky Park’s infinity pool, sip cocktails in Ce La Vi Club Lounge and dance on the open-air Vue Terrace, all 200 meters above the city. The resort below has everything you could possibly need or want, including the Sands casino, a luxurious spa, high-end boutiques, theatrical performances, the ArtScience Museum and dozens of other entertainment options. The Presidential and Chairman suites are your best bets for a pampering experience.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Capella Singapore
Capella is known for its elegantly luxurious property that blends colonial and modern buildings on Sentosa Island’s Palawan Beach. Choose a room with an incredible view of the South China Sea, and you’ll often gain an in-room whirlpool. You’ll have the services of a personal assistant throughout your stay, use of Rolls Royce Phantom or Mercedes Benz limousines, access to a well-stocked library, an on-site spa and fitness center, three waterfall pools and preferred access to the island’s top golf courses.

Raffles Hotel
As you travel the hotel’s private driveway, Raffles’ classic architecture and stately property makes you feel as if you’ve stepped back into a more refined era. Tropical gardens, upscale boutiques like Louis Vuitton and Armani Casa and traditional afternoon tea service merely enhance the hotel’s genteel ambiance. Named the No. 2 best hotel in Asia by Conde Nast and a national landmark in its own right, Raffles routinely accommodates international dignitaries, executives and VIPs. While there are more than a dozen restaurants and lounges to choose from at Raffles, be sure to hit the Long Bar to sample the legendary Singapore Sling cocktail, created at Raffles more than 100 years ago.

Those hotels will be more enjoyable if you save on business class airfare to Singapore. Call us today 888 347 7817

item.title: Relish the Good Life: Cheap Business Class Flights to the World’s Best Exotic Beach Destinations
item.summary:
Top 10 Most Spectacular Beaches outside of the U.S.
Getting to Asia, Oceania, Europe and the Caribbean amid the luxury of first class air is just the beginning of a glamorous trip abroad. With 71 percent of the earth covered in water, there are thousands of irresistible beaches around the world. Below are the first five of our top 10 favorite beach regions around the globe.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Philippines
Sporting breathtaking marble cliffs and seas that are an impossibly brilliant shade of blue, El Nido is the pinnacle of Philippine beaches. The El Nido area alone has 50 beaches, and its larger Palawan region has even more. Its beach sand is powder-fine and blindingly white, just perfect for cushioning tender feet. Legendary waterfalls and prehistoric caves give the area an added mystique and are perfect for an afternoon of exploring.

Luxury hotels: Pangulasian Island Resort, Amanpulo, Shangri-La Boracay

Queensland, Australia
With more than 10,000 beaches in Australia, there’s a beach for nearly every individual taste. For a popular Christmas Day beach trip close to Sydney, locals and visitors head to Bondi. For incredible surfing, conventional wisdom points to the North Coast’s Angourie. Queensland, in particular, is home to a wide range of stunning beaches, from Surfers Paradise to Mission Beach. When it comes to stunning ecology and terrific activities, though, it’s tough to beat the captivating expanse of beaches around Fraser Island. The island’s eastern 75-Mile Beach is a favorite for all-terrain vehicles, and and it is actually a registered highway. Five-star resorts aren’t abundant on Fraser, so visitors might consider staying nearby or much farther north among the Whitsunday Islands.

Luxury Hotel Near Fraser Island: Akama Resort
item.bodyColumn_2:
Luxury Hotel in the Whitsundays: Qualia Resort

Malaysia
Once a hideaway for pirates, Malaysia’s Langkawi is one of the region’s most treasured beach areas. One of the best ways to experience the destination is to take advantage of the many cheap deals to Singapore, then hop a regional jet or cruise ship to the Lankgawi archipelago of 99 islands. Its beaches offer soft, super-fine sand, coconut-laden palm trees and deep azure seawater, and its main island is the place to go for duty-free chocolate and alcohol.

Luxury Hotels: Four Seasons Lankgawi, The Adaman, The Datai, The Westin Lankgawi

Cape Town, South Africa

With iconic Table Mountain as its backdrop, Cape Town is stunning, and its beaches are equally magnificent. Visitors can sunbathe and hobnob with Cape Town society at Clifton 4th Beach or enjoy views of the 12 Apostles and catch a game of beach volleyball at Camps Bay beach. For warmer Indian Ocean water and captivating penguin-watching, travelers head to Boulders Beach. Llandudno is a well-kept local secret, beloved by residents for its surfing and thrilling sunsets.

Luxury Hotels: Twelve Apostles Hotel, One&Only Hotel, Taj Cape Town, Ellerman House, Table Bay Hotel

Turks & Caicos
No list of amazing beaches is complete without at least one of the Caribbean’s delightful retreats. The Turks & Caicos archipelago is an alluring Caribbean destination, offering visitors incredible vistas of turquoise water, ridiculously soft sand and a variety of luxury resorts. The world’s third largest reef system is nearby, enticing visitors into a day of snorkeling, scuba diving and sightseeing. The islands’ welcoming hospitality also makes the Turks & Caicos ideal for relaxing on the beach, enjoying a massage or kayaking around the coves. Best of all, travelers have plenty of travel options with cheap airfare to the main island of Providenciales.

Luxury Hotels: Amanyara, The Regent Grand Turks & Caicos, Parrot Cay, The West Bay Club

item.title: Savor the Luxury of Travel: Find First Class Deals to the World’s Best Beaches
item.summary: Top 10 Most Spectacular Beaches outside the U.S. - Part 2 Relaxing on a sandy beach, sipping cocktails and enjoying gorgeous ocean views is a popular dream vacation for many travelers, and few beach getaways are as pleasurable as those found in exciting exotic destinations. This continuation of our series on top international beaches takes travelers from the ancient cliffs of Greece to the warm embrace of French Polynesia. Most of these top destinations are easily accessed, especially with the proliferation of cheap business class and first class flights available today.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Thailand
With some of the most iconic tropical beaches, Thailand is a favorite of travelers looking to blend exotic adventures with lush scenery and even lusher resorts. While Thailand’s Phuket on the Andaman Coast is frequented by many travelers, the region still has a few hidden gems. These treasures include Nai Harn Beach, where forests of trees meet the shoreline and Ao Sane, where snorkeling is supreme. Phi Phi is another terrific choice for its majestic limestone rock formations and inviting turquoise water.
 
Luxury Hotels: Banyan Tree Samui, Four Seasons Samui, Amanpuri, Anantara Phuket, Banyan Tree Phuket. 
 
Greece
Just as Odysseus found himself lucky to find Corfu, travelers will relish all of the Greek island’s abundant delights. Sensational cliffs are the backdrop of Corfu’s beaches, sprinkled with wildflower fields and nearby olive and citrus groves. Glyfada Beach welcomes visitors to broad, golden beaches and dramatic views. Swim out to the small island rocks for a look back at the island and idyllic cliff diving spots, or relax in one of the beach’s charming tavernas. For au naturel sunbathing, head to nearby Miriotissa. There are usually quite a few first and business class deals to Europe that can transport travelers to the area in style.
 
Luxury Hotels: Grecotel Corfu Imperial, Marbella Beach Corfu
 
French Polynesia
Gracious locals, legendary beaches and exquisite scenery greet visitors to French Polynesia’s Bora Bora island. Perched among the island’s inviting lagoons are stilted villas, which serve as the perfect home base for bountiful activities. Matira is one of the island’s most famous beaches, but there are plenty of options around the island.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Luxury Hotels: Four Seasons Bora Bora, St. Regis Bora Bora, both InterContinental Bora Bora properties, Sofitel Bora Bora
 
Maldives
Warm, soft water and fascinating coral reefs are two of the top draws of The Maldives archipelago. While snorkeling and scuba diving along the reefs is a popular way to enjoy the colorful tropical fish, it’s equally delightful to just sit back and enjoy the picturesque palm trees, brilliant sunsets and pampering resort services. The islands of the archipelago nation are known for their sumptuous resorts, so there are plenty of options for travelers.
 
Luxury Hotels: Four Seasons (Landaa Giraavaru and Kuda Huraa), One&Only Reethi Rah, Shangri-La Villingili
 
 
Seychelles
A trip to this Indian Ocean group of islands is the ultimate dream beach vacation. Its La Digue island boasts one of the world’s most photographed beaches, famous for its pink sand, scenic palm trees and appealing rock formations. With 115 islands in the Seychelles, though, there are dozens of other beaches to visit, each with its own pleasures. Savvy travelers will look for discounted flights in first or business class so that they can spend a longer holiday in one of the area’s many luxury resorts.
 
Luxury Hotels: Raffles Praslin, Four Seasons, Maia Luxury Resort

item.title: Divine European Travels: Book Discounted First Class Seats Then Follow These Tips
item.summary: Planning a successful trip to Europe means spending a little time taking care of important details before you leave. Traveling with cheap first class airfare, notifying credit card companies and banks of your destination and prepping your mobile phone will assure you have a worry-free vacation.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The anticipation of a delightful trip to the Continent is just part of the pleasure of travel, especially if you're flying in luxury thanks to cheap business class tickets to Europe. Before you get swept away with dreams of a flawless holiday, though, you should spend some time taking care of a few details. Planning ahead will ultimately make your trip more enjoyable, ensuring that you, your money and your plans are safe while abroad.

Money, Money, Money
Notify your credit card companies that you'll be traveling to specific countries in Europe and double-check that you understand any fees you may be charged for using your cards abroad. While on the call, request a chip-and-pin or smart card. Most European automated payment machines like those found at toll roads, train ticket booths and parking garages require chip-and-pin cards. Be sure to safeguard your cards in a money belt or similar product and carry your cash in a couple of different locations to avoid pick-pocket woes.

Getting Around Town
If you plan to rent a car, you'll need your U.S.-issued driver's license. Some countries also require an International Driving Permit, so check the rules for driving in your specific destinations. Similarly, if you plan to take taxis or private cars in a certain town, check the local requirements for distance limits, payment options and rates.
item.bodyColumn_2:
In London, only the iconic black cars are licensed taxis, and they are available for hire only if their yellow "taxi" signs are lit. Some European countries have experienced protests surrounding the use of Uber, so it's always a good idea to find out which Uber services are allowed in your destination country. Knowing how to navigate local taxi services and public transportation before you disembark from your first class flights helps keep your journey hassle-free.


Smart Travel with Smart Phones
Your smart phone or iPad can be an invaluable asset while you're traveling through Europe, but you don't want to be surprised with an astronomical wireless bill when you get home. To avoid any unexpected expenses, call your smart phone company before you leave and clarify potential charges. Also, ask the company to unlock your phone for international use. If your phone company offers an international calling plan, sign up for it. If not, purchase a SIM card at a mobile phone store in your destination country, but do not do this at the arrival airport. The local European SIM card will allow you to communicate with other members of your traveling party and local hotels, restaurants and tour companies throughout your stay. You’ll also be able to use the device to book last minute flights for spur-of-the-moment side trips.

item.title: Making Sense of Travel Dollars: From Discounted Business Class Flights to Smart Credit Cards
item.summary: An on-budget trip to Asia or Europe begins with finding cheap airfare in comfortable, premium cabins. It also includes understanding how current international financial events affect exchange rates, knowing how to cheaply convert currency, preparing for international credit card transactions and finding apps to help track expenses.
item.bodyColumn_1:
No one wants to spend more than necessary on a trip abroad, even if they’re traveling in the lap of luxury aboard first class. Travelers spend countless hours searching for discount first class flights to Singapore, London and other exciting destinations, but they often don’t realize that they should spend an equal amount of time planning ways to make the most of their money while traveling.

Dollars, Euros and Pounds, Oh My!
Recent financial troubles in Greece, Spain, Portugal, Latvia and Ireland can make it difficult to know how to handle money while in Europe. Add in the complication of knowing which European countries have retained their own currencies, and you have even more confusion. The temptation for many U.S. travelers will be to simply use dollars to avoid the hassle and fees of converting money to euros and pounds, but that's a money-losing strategy. Where possible, travelers should convert cash to local currency at postal banks where exchange fees are less onerous. 

Before the trip, travelers should download an easy-to-use currency conversion app on their smart phones. Even though travelers aren’t paying in dollars, it’s important to know the cost of purchases, hotel stays, restaurant bills and train tickets. The conversion apps give travelers an easy way to understand real costs so they can make smart purchase decisions. Maps and international flight booking apps are also helpful so travelers can navigate their destinations or buy last minute business class flights for fun side trips.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Give Yourself Some Credit
Using credit cards in foreign countries may be easiest, but it’s important to check ahead of time what types of credit cards are accepted in a particular country. In some Asian countries, for instance, credit cards may be difficult to use so cash is the way to go.

Most European countries use credit cards that require PIN input along with the card. To avoid complications, travelers should call their credit card companies and request actual chip-and-pin cards that meet the European standard. 

When setting up the chip-and-pin card or when making purchases with credit cards, travelers may be asked whether they want to be charged in dollars or euros. It’s nearly always best to ask the company to charge the purchase in the local European currency. There’s often a fee or mark-up for the store to convert the charges to U.S. dollars, and that’s just wasted money for travelers who want to control their costs.

With a little research and planning, it’s relatively easy for travelers to make the most of their travel budgets. Whether they’re whisking a partner away for a special holiday on cheap first class seats to Jakarta or simply traveling for business, there’s always savings to be found.

item.title: Navigating Abroad: Making the Most of an International Vacation with Cheap Airfare and Smart Ground Transport
item.summary: Savvy travelers to Europe and Asia take the time to research all of their transportation options, whether it’s to find deals on first class or business class seats or it’s to search for a safe way to get from the hotel to a special landmark.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Traveling to a foreign country can be nerve-wracking if you don’t know how you’ll be getting from the endpoint of your cheap first class flight to your hotel. In fact, worrying about how you’ll be getting around your destination city may be one of the biggest sources of travel anxiety. You can ease your mind, though, by learning about your destination city and using a few of our helpful tips.

Taxis
Each country and city has its own rules about licensing taxis, so it’s always best to research the destination city’s taxi system before leaving home. While in the destination city, you can protect yourself by using only licensed taxis, usually identified with a prominent company name. London cabs are always black, making it extra-easy to spot a taxi there. To find a safe taxi, use a downloaded taxi-scheduling app on your smart phone or go to a well-marked taxi stand. For your safety, do not flag down or use a taxi that is not prominently identified with signs and a phone number. 

In some Asian cities, it’s popular for tourists to hop on the back of an unofficial taxi motorcycle for cheap transport around town. While this is definitely an inexpensive way to get around, it can be dangerous given the lack of helmets and unauthorized status of the driver.

To Uber or Not to Uber?
Some European cities have protested the presence of Uber, and that can be frightening for passengers who are caught in the middle of an aggressive protest. Other cities only allow certain types of Uber services to be used. In Paris, for instance, it’s legal to use UberX, but UberPop is not allowed. Always check Uber’s status in your destination city before you leave home if you plan to use the service.

 

Car rentals
For travelers who want their own wheels, renting a car in most major European and Asian cities is relatively easy, if you know the requirements ahead of time. Most international airports offer car rental counters that are easily accessed after you disembark from your discounted first class flights.
item.bodyColumn_2:
If you’ve researched the requirements and still want to rent a car, be prepared for encountering toll roads. Some European countries like Belarus use electronic pay systems while others like Croatia ask drivers to pay at the end of the toll road. A little pre-travel research provides helpful information about your destination country’s toll road system.

It’s also helpful to download driving maps on a smart device before leaving home so you can avoid purchasing the GPS rental along with the rental car.

In some Asian countries like Bali, travelers prefer to rent motorcycles instead of cars. In addition to less official paperwork, motorcycles are an often-easier way to travel through the region. If you plan on renting a motorcycle, make sure you understand the rules of the road, if there are any, and double-check that you’ll have access to a helmet.

Trains
Europe and some Asian countries like Japan are known for their stellar train systems. Rail passes often provide a more cost-effective way to use train service. If you’re traveling to Europe or Japan, be sure to buy your rail pass before you leave home, and you may even want to book your seat in advance.

In Asia, train quality varies widely. Japan has clean, well-kept commuter and high-speed bullet trains, while Malaysian and Vietnamese trains offer trains of different classes. Overnight trains along some Malaysian Peninsula and Vietnamese routes are popular and comfortable, but lack food service and American-style toilets.

Taking the time to research ground transport options before you leave for your trip can save you money and ensure that you have a safe, enjoyable journey. After all, it would be a shame to start your vacation with a luxurious business class flight only to have your holiday ruined with unsafe ground transport.

item.title: Sampling the Wines of the World: Experience Luxury with Top International Wine-Region Resorts and Discounted First Class Airfare
item.summary: From verdant New Zealand to legendary European wine regions, we adore these five resorts that will please even discriminating palates. Wine isn’t the only thing these resorts have going for them, though, especially when visitors travel there in the A-list comfort of cheap business class seats.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Fron Napa to New England, the U.S. brims with a host of its own celebrated wine regions, but there’s something special about embarking on a lush international wine tour. Aside from flying in the splendor of discounted first class flights, few other travel experiences are as blissful as indulging your senses at a high-end international wine-region resort. 

Toscana Resort Castelfalfi - Florence, Italy
Experience the glamor, power and intrigue of the Medici family’s Tuscan estate, now a hilltop resort surrounded by vineyards, olive orchards and a revived medieval town. Visitors can sample local wines, including the area’s prized Chianti, and nosh on dishes prepared by a Michelin-starred chef at La Rocca. After a peaceful night in one of the resorts beautifully appointed villas, visitors can take a dip in one of four pools, practice their swings at resort golf courses or learn to make a special dish at the local cooking school. 

The Farm at Cape Kidnappers - Hawke’s Bay, New Zealand
The Farm is intimate with just 22 guest suites, each boasting a balcony for viewing the Pacific Ocean, the scenic golf course and the surrounding 6,000-acre cattle and sheep pastures. In addition to touring 70 local wineries, guests can enjoy clay-target shooting, golfing, hiking and ATV tours. Smart travelers can arrive at the resort refreshed, thanks to cheap business class airfare to Auckland, which is one hour away.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Le Quartier Francais - Franschhoek, South Africa
Exclusive and colorful, Le Quartier Francais gives visitors easy access to 40 local wineries and superb experiences. With just 21 guest rooms, the ambiance of Le Quartier is privileged and impeccable. Award-winning dishes are served at The Tasting Room, and private guides provide attentive service. Guests may visit the on-site cinema, tour the resort’s herb garden or embark on a World Heritage Hike.

Loisium Wine & Spa Resort - Langenlois, Austria
A contemporary masterpiece rising from a verdant vineyard, Loisium is elegant and welcoming. Chic guest rooms are furnished with luxe Wittman furniture, and the resort’s pool, on-site vineyard and 900-year-old wine cellar provide ample entertainment. Spa services are extensive, perfect for soothing muscles after a day spent hiking or cycling. For a special treat, visitors on-site during the resort’s concert season can enjoy dinner in the vineyards while enjoying a live concert.

Les Sources de Caudalie - Bourdeaux-Martillac, France
Combining wine and spa treatments, this resort has pampering down to an art form with vinotherapy treatments like honey and wine wraps and crushed cabernet scrubs. Luscious suites offer private terraces overlooking the vineyard and lake. Wine tours, cooking lessons, tasting lessons, cycling tours and horse-drawn carriage rides allow guests to experience all of Bordeaux’s delights. Discounted flights to France in first and business class are plentiful so visitors can travel to the region in style.

item.title: Sumptuous Travel: Jet Away in First Class Airfare to Experience These Five Over-the-top Resort Pools
item.summary: International travel can be tiring, even when you fly in the luxurious comfort of discounted business class cabins. Savvy travelers can better enjoy the experience when they plan some poolside relaxation in some of the world’s most sumptuous and stunning resort swimming and infinity pools.
item.bodyColumn_1:
We're all about helping you create luxury travel experiences, and every trip should include some pampering downtime. We've got you covered on discounted first class seats so you can relax while you're in the air, and here are some of our favorite incredible resort pools that will satisfy your every pleasure.

Perivolas - Oia, Santorini, Greece
If a picturesque Greek island still isn't enough to fulfill your Aegean dreams, relax in the splendor of Perivolas on the island of Santorini. The epitome of luxury living, Perivolas is an exclusive 17-suite resort with a pool that matches its chic appeal. You'll recognize the luscious pool immediately, thanks to its frequently photographed status as one of the most spectacular infinity pools in the world. Magnificent sunsets, delectable cocktails and poolside naps are de rigeur. The nearby resort of Grace Santorini also boasts an incredible infinity pool that's not to be missed.

Huvafen Fushi - Maldives
You can enjoy your private bungalow pool at Huvafen Fushi, but you'll want to enjoy at least one evening dip in the resort pool. A nighttime experience like no other, this seaside swimming pool twinkles with more than 1,000 tiny fiberoptic lights, creating a sophisticated, magical ambiance. Huvafen Fushi's pool also links to Lonu Veyo, a salt-water flotation pool for a little extra therapeutic TLC.

Marina Bay Sands - Singapore
Thrill-seekers revel in this infinity pool that gives the illusion that you will go floating off the 57-story building. The world's largest and highest rooftop infinity pool, it's reserved only for guests, so you'll have to enjoy the expansive Marina Bay Sands Resort and Casino in order to dip your toes in this breathtaking pond.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Poolside palm trees keep you shaded while you lounge nearby and free-flowing champagne quenches your thirst while enjoying incredible views of the bustling city below. Adrenaline junkies will also want to fly on discounted business class seat to swim in the glass-bottomed Holiday Inn pools in Shanghai. The pools hang over the city from 24 stories above, giving swimmers jaw-dropping views of the city below.

Serengeti by Four Seasons Safari Lodge - Tanzania
A once-in-a-lifetime experience awaits at the Four Seasons Safari Lodge infinity pools. Here, elephants and giraffes freely roam the Serengeti and drink from the watering hole alongside the resort's pool, giving swimmers and loungers a unique view of the region's wildlife. For those who want a more private Serengeti experience, some of the resort's villas and suites have their own private infinity pools with fantastic views of the savannah. 

The Library - Koh Samui, Thailand
Vibrant color is an important part of Thai culture, and that color spills over into one of the country's most stunning seaside pools, The Red Pool. The vivid red and orange hues of The Library pool water is courtesy of gorgeous mosaic glass tiles that line the bottom of the structure. Overlooking the dazzling Gulf of Thailand in the South China Sea, the pool's bright red lounges echo the pool's dramatic statement. To continue the colorful pool experience, take advantage of discount business class tickets and jaunt to the Gold Energy Pool at the St. Regis Lhasa Resort in Tibet where you can enjoy poolside foot massages.

item.title: Even More Luxury Awaits in 2016 with New Five-Star Resorts and Discounted Business Class Tickets
item.summary: Several prestigious hoteliers plan to open exciting new luxury resorts around the world in 2016 and 2017, from the glittering cities of Dubai and London to the chic Lake Como. We recommend traveling to these captivating, world-class cities in comfort via cheap first class tickets.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Whether you’re traveling for business or pleasure, there are plenty of ways to make your journey more enjoyable. Book discounted business class airfare so you can stretch out and enjoy the flight, schedule chauffeur service for easy ground transport, and book yourself into your favorite luxury hotel. If you don’t already have a favorite place to stay in your destination city, there are several international luxury hotels opening in coming months that are sure to satisfy all your needs. 

Bulgari - Dubai
Known for its elegant jewelry designs, Bulgari's hotels have been dazzling the jet-set since 2004. Its newest jewel is set to open in Dubai’s upscale enclave of Jumeirah Bay Island in 2017. Bulgari Dubai will be 1.7 million square feet of lushly landscaped resort space with 20 residential villas and 101 richly appointed guest rooms and suites. Guests can enjoy relaxing treatments at the spa, dine in the signature “ristorante,” dock in the 50-berth marina and socialize in the Bulgari Yacht Club.

Viceroy - Palm Jumeirah, Dubai
The Viceroy is opening its latest hotel on Dubai's posh Palm Jumeirah islands. The beachfront property appeals to all the senses with eye-catching and innovative architecture and exquisite services customized to suit the hotel’s discerning clientele. Chic dining venues, a tranquil spa, a beach club and a variety of other amenities keep travelers of all ages satisfied.
item.bodyColumn_2:
The Langham - Palm Jumeirah, Dubai
With a coveted location directly on the Arabian Gulf, each of The Langham’s 323 guest rooms feature a private waterfront terrace. The resort also offers 53 suites, many with private plunge pools. A bevy of restaurants and bars, a spectacular two-story recreation center and the Chuan Spa provide delightful entertainment and relaxation, while the resort’s amenity-filled Traveler’s Lounge is an oasis for guests with early or late arrivals and departures.

Il Sereno - Como Italy
If you’re jetting to Europe, take some time to head to the chic, glamorous shores of Italy’s Lake Como. The Il Sereno is slated to open in the spring of 2016, offering guests magnificent views of the Southern Alps, historic shoreline villas and charming villages. The hotel makes the most of its waterfront location, offering a private dock for guest arrivals and the hotel’s bespoke wooden boats. Il Sereno assures seclusion and privacy by providing only 34 suites.

Great Scotland Yard Hotel - London
Once housing some of Europe’s most brilliant detectives, London’s original Scotland Yard building will soon have a new purpose: grand hotel. The unique location alone makes the hotel a much-awaited event, but its design, amenities and services put it over the top. The five-star resort’s best suite costs more than $15,000 a night. The hotel is expected to be one of the finest in the capital city, so you may want to hop the most convenient discounted first class flight to London just so you can spend a night in the hotel’s grandeur.

item.title: A Trip of Luxury: Fly in Cheap First Class Seats to Visit the World’s Most Luxurious Spas
item.summary: This year’s World Luxury Spa Award winners offer unique, refined and rejuvenating experiences from the U.K to Australia and a host of points in between. Continue the lusciously indulgent journey by flying to these fascinating destinations with opulent but economical first class airfare deals.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Take a breather from the hustle and bustle of everyday life by touring some of the world’s most luxurious spas. The World Luxury Spa Awards for 2015 were recently released, and there’s no time like the present to hop on a discounted first class flight and trek to some of these world-class destinations for your own little piece of paradise. Below are just a few of this year’s award winners.

The Woodland Spa - Burnley, United Kingdom
Taking top honors as Global Spa of the Year, The Woodland Spa is located amidst the tranquil, rolling hills of Lancashire. The exclusive spa features a hydrotherapy pool, serenity pool, outdoor infinity pool, sauna, salt steam and traditional steam rooms, ice fountain, Rasul mud chamber and individualized experience showers. The spa also offers massage therapy, Neom happiness and sleep treatments, facials and a delectable spa dining menu, creating a luscious experience that is unequaled.

SO Spa Sofitel - El Gezirah Island, Cairo, Egypt
Spa-goers can indulge in all of the Sofitel’s rejuvenating spa treatments while gazing at the picturesque Nile River. A Turkish steam bath complements the spa’s other treatments, from massage to a relaxing Jacuzzi. Those who revel in the sensation of vigorous exercise followed by therapeutic massage and steam baths can enjoy the hotel’s fitness center first. If dinner or a night on the town is to follow, spa guests can also enjoy a visit to the on-site hair salon.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Gwinganna Lifestyle Retreat - Queensland, Australia
Gwinganna is an experience not to be missed so book cheap business class tickets to Australia and prepare to be amazed. The retreat is beautifully located on the Gold Coast’s Hinterland where breathtaking waterfalls, gorgeous wooded areas and scenic ranges set the stage for ecotours and transformative treatments. The purpose of the retreat is to provide restful space where guests can balance mind, body and soul, recommit to healthy lifestyle choices and withdraw from the choices that hinder our health and our lives.

Satori Spa Bab Al Shams Desert Resort & Spa - Dubai, United Arab Emirates
There’s also plenty of captivating nature at Bab Al Shams. With its traditional Arabic fort ambiance, the spa is nestled in the desert dunes with cool, shaded outdoor walkways and peaceful water features. Satori features wellness treatments, saunas, steam rooms, a full-service health spa, skin care programs, reflexology treatments and a host of other therapies and revitalizing rituals. There’s also an indoor garden, outdoor shower, yoga and massage areas. The soothing warmth of the desert spa is just a 45-minute drive from Dubai International Airport so it’s convenient even if you are flying on discounted business class seats to Dubai for work.

Don’t miss Part Two of our celebration of the world’s best spas in our next blog post.

item.title: Trip of a Lifetime: Fly in Discounted First Class Flights to the World’s Best Luxury Spa Destinations
item.summary: Wrapping up our two-part series on the world’s best luxury spas, we explore the beauty of Saudi Arabia’s Astralis, Hungary’s Mandala Spa and Turkey’s NG Sapanca-Aliva Spa. When flying to these destinations in comfort using first and business class deals, you’ll experience an unparalleled level of indulgence.
item.bodyColumn_1:
When it comes to relaxation, few holidays surpass a jaunt in luxurious first class airfare en route to the pampering splendor of a world-class spa. From fitness and wellness spas to resort and beauty spas, there are hundreds of luxury spas to choose from around the world. Luckily, the World Luxury Hotel Awards recently announced the winners of this year’s Luxury Spa Awards, giving discerning travelers a good place to start.

Mandala Day Spa - Hungary
Mandala charms and entices even the most discriminating spa goer, offering a full menu of body wraps, massages and hammam. Guests can luxuriate in customized bath rituals like the aromatic oil or Dead Sea salt hot bath or the Cleopatra bath ritual, all in private, beautifully appointed candlelit rooms. Body wraps range from the Sweet Pleasure Chocolate Body Wrap and the Detoxifying Balinese Wrap to the Privilege Gold Wrap. Mandala’s body scrubs feature a menu of Ayurvedic body peeling, Exotic Spice Body Exfoliation and Privilege Pearl Body Peeling. An onsite beauty salon provides manicures, pedicures and facials.

Aliva Spa at NG Sapanca Wellness & Convention Center - Turkey

Located at the edge of a peaceful, verdant forest, NG is a full-service, five-star luxury resort designed to please all the senses. Named the world’s best luxury resort spa, NG delights guests with dozens of various spa and massage treatments, a luscious outdoor pool with poolside beds and cocktail service, fine dining and plentiful hiking, canoeing, cycling and other exhilarating recreation.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Guests can laze the day away in peaceful hammocks or enjoy activities on the nearby lake, then refresh in the resort’s indulgent spa. Whether you’ve flown in discounted first class seats to the resort for business or vacation, you’ll want to return to the resort again and again to experience the one-of-a-kind luxury.

 

Astralis Health Club & Spa - Saudi Arabia
Set in the sumptuous design of an Arabic palace, Astralis offers only the best fitness and spa facilities. The spa features a wide variety of anti-aging and hydrating facial treatments using Dermalogica and Thalgo serums, reflexology, cellulite treatments, Moroccan Hammam rituals and treatments customized for pregnant women. Massage options include hot stone, lomilomi, Thai, shiatsu, Indian Head and full-body massage. Those who want to test their endurance can enjoy a host of six-to-eight-week boot camp body courses, while those who simply want a rejuvenating experience can bask in the spa’s luxury spa body treatments. These luxury options range from Seaweed Back Treatments to the Thalgo Indoceane Journey treatment that includes body polish, Cleopatra milk bath, full-body massage and a body wrap.

With all of the sensational spa experiences available around the world, make this the year you indulge yourself a little. With the World Luxury Spa Awards as your tour guide and cheap first class tickets as your vehicle, you can trek around the world to experience all of the luxury and pampering available.

item.title: Superyachts and First Class Seats: Creating a World-Class Adventure on the High Seas
item.summary: Jetsetting around the Mediterranean, Tyrrhenian and Coral seas is more pleasurable when docking at a world-class port city. We take you to four exciting ports and their magnificent cities, all offering sensational food, drink and gaiety. Sailing through life in a superyacht has never looked so good.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Fresh ocean air, glorious sunshine and incomparable privacy entice many savvy travelers to the world of sailing. Yachting has entranced the world’s elite for decades, and some of the most exciting international cities cater to this thrilling pastime. We recommend flying to these top yachting cities in the spacious comfort of discounted business class seats so that you’re ready to revel in the grandeur of a palatial yacht while setting sail for other spectacular seaside cities.

Porto Cervo - Sardinia, Italy
Catering to the haute monde, Porto Cervo is ideal for megayachts touring the Costa Smeralda, and Sardinia is a perfect Tyrrhenian Sea setting. Home to the jet set since the 1960s, Sardinia is the place to see and be seen. Its bountiful five-star hotels, exquisite restaurants with equally stunning views and plentiful boutiques offer refined service, and its glitzy nightclubs and beach clubs provide plenty of revelry.

Ibiza Magna - Ibiza, Spain
Consummately chic and glamorous, Ibiza is another popular playground for the upper crust. Glossy beach clubs like the Blue Marlin and swanky supper clubs like Cavalli Club abound, providing ample entertainment for a night off the yacht. Ibiza Magna itself is the perfect locale for berthing a yacht, putting travelers in the heart of historic Old Town, Dalt Vila, where an ancient drawbridge leads to narrow and winding cobblestone streets and untold delights.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Cairns Marlin Marina - Cairns, Australia
Sailors who want a different yachting experience can book a cheap first class flight to Cairns International Airport and head to the exclusive Cairns Marlin Marina to charter a yacht. While in Cairns, travelers can savor the lush five-star services of Cairns Esplanade Lagoon, where luxury hotels, restaurants and boutiques thrive. The marina is also an ideal starting point for exploring the Great Barrier Reef and all of the Coral Sea’s pleasures. Farther afield, yachters can also head to the South Pacific islands for more tropical indulgences.

Port Hercule - Monaco
The pinnacle of all luxury ports, Port Hercule is frequented by the glitterati, the powerful and European royalty. The 40-acre deepwater port is a natural bay that has welcomed sailors to the Rock of Monaco for centuries. Breathtaking views of the Mediterranean await travelers to this port, and electrifying adventures in Monte Carlo’s casinos are just a few minutes away by car. 

Of course, there are dozens of other exciting megayacht or superyacht locations around the world, from Saint Tropez to the Andaman Islands. Travelers can make the most of their time and explore amazing sailing itineraries from one hotspot to another using the abundant availability of cheap first class and business class tickets.
