item.title: Taking Tea: Celebrating English Traditions from Afternoon Tea to Royally Good Business Class Deals
item.summary: Whether you want to experience high tea in a formal setting or in a comfortable, social ambiance, our favorite high tea restaurants provide the quintessential British experience. You’ll delight in fresh pastries baked by celebrated pastry chefs, English classics like scones and clotted cream and bountiful teas.
item.bodyColumn_1:
There’s more to a decadently satisfying London holiday than booking a luxurious first class flight, staying in the high-brow Kensington neighborhood and partying in Mayfair and Soho. An English holiday simply isn’t complete until you’ve enjoyed a cuppa from one of London’s most treasured tea houses. Here are just a few of our favorites:

Claridge’s
Known around the world for its elegant but never stuffy ambiance, Claridge’s serves a host of English favorites like scones, Cornish clotted cream, Marco Polo tea jelly and cucumber sandwiches. Of course, there are dozens of other delicacies, as well, such as chocolate pastries, creme brulee, chicken sandwiches and fruit-topped pastries. Live piano and cello music accompany diners enjoying the edible delights.

The Orangery, Kensington Gardens 
A palace atrium is the perfect setting for visitors to savor tea and champagne while gazing at Kensington Palace’s magnificent gardens. Built by Queen Anne in 1704 to protect her beloved orange trees, The Orangery now charms visitors, business professionals and high society alike with its afternoon tea menu of smoked salmon and cream cheese mini bagels, cucumber and fresh mint sandwiches, Coronation chicken wraps and delectable pastries. 

Palm Court, The Ritz London
Gilded statues, ornate decor and a spectacularly designed ceiling add a lavish touch to tea at The Ritz’ Palm Court. The Ritz is so steeped in grand architecture, in fact, that it’s worth hopping on a discounted business class flight to London just to experience the hotel’s ambiance.
item.bodyColumn_2:
The Ritz honors its 100-year-old high tea tradition by serving handmade sandwiches with all of the traditional British fillings, fresh-baked scones, Devonshire clotted cream, a variety of pastries and 16 loose leaf teas. Service is formal and exacting, complementing the refined atmosphere created by the opulent setting and rich strains of live piano music. A dress code is strictly enforced, and reservations are highly recommended.

Thames Foyer, The Savoy
The foyer’s beautiful glass dome encases guests in natural light as they dine on The Savoy’s scrumptious menu of warm scones accompanied by jams and clotted cream, tasty finger sandwiches and seasonal pastries and cakes like the divine dark chocolate and pistachio opera cake. Live piano music fills theThames Foyer and its adjoining Winter Garden Gazebo with dulcet tones perfect for an afternoon tea.

Relishing all of London’s exquisite amusements can be pricey, especially if you plan to take high tea each day of your visit. Most of these tea services will set you back about £40 per person, and lodging, transportation and entertainment can be steeply priced. Be sure to take advantage of the abundant availability of discounted first class tickets to London so you can indulge in all of London’s delicious diversions.

item.title: Burj Al Arab Jumeirah and Discount First Class Tickets Are Welcome Oases
item.summary: We take a look at Dubai’s magnificent Burj al Arab Jumeirah and discover the reasons it is one of the world’s most awarded and vaunted hotels. From luxury airport transport and private butlers to luscious spa treatments, Burj al Arab Jumeirah is the place to stay.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Billing itself as the world’s most luxurious hotel, Dubai’s Burj al Arab Jumeirah’s confidence is well-deserved. It repeatedly earns top accolades from luxury travel magazines and organizations and is a welcome respite for discerning travelers who expect first-rate service after a long, business class flight.

The hotel’s consummate service actually begins at Dubai International Airport. There, resort staff meet you with a chauffer-driven Rolls Royce or a private helicopter ready to whisk you away to the elegant hotel. From the Rolls, you’ll be treated to your first glimpse of the magnificent sail-like architecture that defines Burj al Arab. The helicopter ride is a treat in itself, giving you an incredible view of gleaming Dubai and the one-of-a-kind scene of islands designed to form palm trees and sea horses. Your breathtaking landing puts you atop the 28th level, offering even more spectacular views.

Once inside the hotel, the polished service continues with private reception areas on each floor and options for private butlers who anticipate your every need. Every guest room in the hotel is a suite, designed in a modern style with a nod to Arab tradition and aesthetics. Even the most modest one-bedroom suite is a two-story delight with incredible views of the Arabian Gulf and majestic beds that invite you to sleep away the jet lag from your tiring but affordable first class flight.
item.bodyColumn_2:
While the suites’ accommodations, service and views may tempt you to stay in your rooms for the duration of your trip, there are plenty of treasures to be found in the rest of the hotel. For recreation, the hotel offers four swimming pools and a private beach, free access to Wild Wadi Waterpark, a fitness center and a kids’ club. 

After a day spent shopping in Dubai’s glittering, world-class malls or sightseeing through the desert, there’s nothing more alluring than a pampering treatment in the hotel’s Talise Spa. The spa is actually a destination in its own right, frequently earning awards as the world’s most luxurious spa. The spa menu includes aqua retreats, saunas, body wraps and a wide variety of massage options.

Dining is equally sumptuous at Burj al Arab, ranging from an unforgettable repast under the world’s tallest atrium to al fresco dining while star gazing. Each of the hotel’s nine restaurants and lounges are distinct in ambiance and flavor, but all offer impeccable service and perfectly executed dishes and drinks.

item.title: Top Luxury Golf Resorts for Continent-Hoppers Are Just a Relaxing Business Class Flight Away
item.summary: The world is full of exciting first class seats and luxury golf resorts guaranteed to challenge, thrill and pamper the savvy traveler and golfer. We explore a few of the many world-class golf resorts around the globe, from the sport’s birthplace in Scotland to China and Brunei.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The world’s most thrilling golf resorts await, and you can easily reach them with a host of incredibly cheap business class tickets currently available to Europe, China and Canada. For the golf lover, there is no better trip than one that includes 18 holes of spectacular golfing and five-star accommodations. Here are just a few of our favorites:

Mission Hills Shenzhen, China
Expansive doesn’t even begin to describe this 12-square-mile golf resort. With 12 resort and championship golf courses, you can play a different course every day of your stay and experience all of the lush scenery surrounding the resort. The property also encompasses four clubhouses, golf and tennis academies, 51 tennis courts, the largest spa destination in China and an exhibition center. The five-star hotel is China’s only golf-integrated resort, providing beautifully appointed guest rooms and suites with a warm, tropical flair. Fine and casual dining are also well covered across six restaurants, and a premiere lounge service keeps your clothing pressed, your shoes polished and your kids cared for.

Fairmont St Andrews, Scotland
What better way to relish golf than in its beautiful birthplace? Experience the tradition and history of the sport while taking on two of the world’s most treasured courses, The Kittocks and The Torrance. The two championship courses are just part of this resort’s 520 acres along the North Sea. Warm up for a round of golf in the full-service fitness center and enjoy a little post-golf relaxation in the resort’s luscious signature spa.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Five restaurants offer dishes that tempt and satisfy your palate, and the castle-like estate’s 209 guest rooms are the exceptional retreat you expect from a five-star Fairmont property. The resort is easily accessed by taking advantage of the many cheap business class to London offerings and a short regional flight to Edinburgh or Glasgow.

Empire Hotel & Country Club, Bandar Sari Begawan, Brunei Darussalam
With an estate fit for a sultan, The Empire is a lavish resort known for its opulent furnishings and services. Guest accommodations range from gorgeous and spacious rooms to magnificent suites and extravagant villas. Seven restaurants serve delectable dishes, while poolside snack service keeps hunger pangs at bay during an afternoon swim. The championship golf course was designed by Jack Nicklaus and gives golfers breathtaking views of the sea from the clifftop fairways.

The Westin Bear Mountain Victoria Golf Resort and Spa, Victoria, BC
Challenging fairways and bunkers are carved among the mountains and towering pine trees for a truly unique and inspiring golf experience at The Westin Bear Mountain. The resort’s two championship golf courses feature ocean, mountain and valley views and helpful services like a club valet, a power golf cart with GPS and a practice facility. The grand, lodge-like setting of the hotel is equally superb, providing guests with world-class guest rooms and suites and panoramic views of the golf courses and Mount Finlayson. The tranquil Sante Spa Victoria provides just the right touch of pampering after a day on the links, and the region’s ample outdoor recreation facilities and bike trails keep the whole family active and entertained. For an even more pleasurable trip, be sure to book discounted first class airfare to Vancouver.

item.title: Book Discounted First Class Seats to Abu Dhabi for Five-Star Service
item.summary: Emirates Palace offers the ultimate Arabian Gulf experience, from a private beach and luxury marina to champagne and caviar service. We review the details that make Emirates Palace an unparalleled property, including its 24-hour butler service, abundant fine dining, serene spa, tranquil gardens and gold-and-marble guest rooms.
item.bodyColumn_1:
After an indulgent first class flight to Abu Dhabi, it’s not difficult to find luscious five-star accommodations in the glistening, cosmopolitan city. After all, it’s one of the richest cities in the world in one of the largest and most powerful emirates on the Arabian Peninsula. Emirates Palace Abu Dhabi surpasses even the elevated expectations of Abu Dhabi’s elite and the world’s jet-setters, providing an oasis of pampering service and exquisite accommodations that discerning travelers won’t soon forget.

Emirates Palace is located along the Persian Gulf, providing its own private beach for guests to enjoy. The 1.3-kilometer beach leads to the resort’s marina, where guests can berth their luxury yachts or charter a boat for a cruise around the bay and gulf. Emirates Palace Resort is one of the most expensive hotels ever built, and no expense is spared in creating a grand experience for its guests.

Day and night, 24-hour butler service provides personal attention around the clock. This bespoke butler service is a welcome respite after a long flight to Abu Dhabi, even if guests traveled amid the comfort and luxury of first class airfare. More relaxation is found the the resort’s various guest rooms, ranging from six styles of suites to three styles of lavish guest rooms, all appointed in marble and gold embellishments fit for a sheikh.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Guests can blissfully unwind even more in the resort’s spa, where rapturous treatments and amenities include a traditional Moroccan Hammam, a Gentleman’s Tonic Establishment, customized massage treatments and manicure and pedicure services. The spa also features a beautifully equipped fitness center.

Arabic hospitality is fully displayed in the resort’s 14 restaurants, lounges, cafes and bars. Guests can sample traditional fare, flavorful Italian dishes, fresh seafood, mouthwatering barbecue and a variety of other cuisines from around the world. The resort’s lounges and bars are also wide-ranging, providing the perfect spot to enjoy a quiet cocktail with a friend or an elegant sampling of champagne and caviar. A taste of Cuba is found at the resort’s Havana Club, where guests can sip rich cognac while relishing a prized cigar.

Whether travelers are in Abu Dhabi for business or pleasure, Emirates Palace is an experience not to be missed. The resort is conveniently located in the heart of Abu Dhabi, so it’s easy to reach via limousine after enjoying discounted first class tickets to Abu Dhabi International Airport. Guests who prefer making a more dramatic entrance can arrive at the resort by seaplane, helicopter, yacht or powerboat.

item.title: Reigning Hotels: Match Your Lavish First Class Flight With Regal European Castle Hotels
item.summary: Europe is full of historic castles and medieval chateaux that offer unique five-star lodging for savvy travelers. We list a few of our favorite castle hotels in Europe so you can create a luxury travel experience that is more than just luxurious last minute first class airfare.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Creating a royal holiday is more than simply booking first class seats, scheduling a modern five-star hotel and zipping around town in a chauffered car. The ultimate regal vacation includes a luxury stay in some of Europe's most exclusive castles, chateaux and palaces. 

Ashford Castle, Ireland
Sculpted gardens, a lakeside setting, impressive turrets and a long, storied history make the 13th-century Ashford Castle a glorious experience. The castle interior is majestic with richly paneled walls, sparkling chandeliers, 68 lovingly restored guest rooms and 14 lavish staterooms and suites. Home to the oldest falconry school in Ireland, the castle still entertains guests with falconry experiences as well as charter luxury cruises, clay shooting, golf, tennis, cycling, equestrian activities and kayaking. The on-site spa helps guests relax after a busy, active day on the 350-acre castle estate.

Swinton Park, England
No country castle is complete without ivy-covered turrets, sheep grazing on the verdant grounds and swans gliding through the castle lake, and Swinton has them all. Guests are content to stay on-site throughout their stay, enjoying luscious spa treatments, classes at the castle's cookery school and savoring themed dining events. There's also falconry, a walled garden and a Druid Temple for guests to explore. The 20,000-acre estate is bordered by 200 acres of wooded parkland so guests have plenty of space to fly a kite, hike, shoot, ride horses, golf and fish.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Chateau de Bagnols, Lyon, France
After a rejuvenating stay at one of the U.K. castles, we recommend you take a last minute business class flight to France to explore the country’s incredible chateaux. 

While most travelers may flock to the Loire Valley chateaux, discerning travelers head to Beaujolais and Chateau de Bagnols. A medieval drawbridge and moat still protect the chateau's plentiful antiques and objets d'art, giving guests the true essence of the high life in a 13th-century French castle. Even with its opulent, historic furnishings, the chateau still makes room for modern amenities and services, including a swimming pool and three- and five-course meals at the chateau's elegant restaurant. 

Ciragan Palace Kempinski, Istanbul
An entirely different experience is found in Ciragan Palace, named Europe's Leading Hotel by the World Travel Awards. The palace's cosmopolitan setting only enhances its appeal, giving guests incredible views of the Bosphorus and city lights. Palm trees flank the palace and its immense infinity pool, adding to the hotel's unique ambiance. Guests revel in luxury on-site spa services, a fully equipped fitness center, a shopping arcade, a salon and delectable fine dining. 

Of course, it's always lovely to let yourself be whisked away on last minute first class flights to stunning locales, but it's even better when you immerse yourself in the luxurious and historic palaces of the region. We hope you explore some of these incredible properties so you can create your own majestic holiday.

item.title: Hotel Arts Barcelona is the Ideal Place to Recharge after A Last Minute Business Class Trip to Catalonia
item.summary: Hotel Arts Barcelona is a top-rated luxury hotel on Spain’s coast, in the heart of Barcelona and colorful Catalonia. Stunning modern architecture, easy access to beaches and the marina, and spacious rooms and suites help the hotel stand out from the crowd of hotel options.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The recent Spanish election and success of Catalan nationalists reminds us how much we enjoy experiencing Catalan culture, sites and cuisine. As the heart of Catalonia, Barcelona is a warm beacon to travelers looking for a unique and vibrant stay after a pampering business class flight. Barcelona is home to a wealth of upscale hotels and luxurious resorts, and one of our favorites is the chic, modern masterpiece Hotel Arts Barcelona.

Hotel Arts capitalizes on its location along the scenic Port Olimpic marina with unparalleled views of the azure Mediterranean. Hotel guests merely have to step foot out of the hotel to enjoy the Barceloneta boardwalk and captivating local beaches. Even better, the historic center of the city is just a few blocks away. 

The hotel itself is a sea of blue glass and white steel-beam architecture, a cosmopolitan oasis in a city filled with historic architecture.

Along the hotel’s oceanfront rests the landmark golden fish sculpture designed by Frank Gehry and the hotel’s refreshing swimming pool, hot tub and gardens. Those who need to grab last minute business class tickets for an unexpected business detour are also delighted to find that the hotel is just 20 minutes from Barcelona Airport.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Guests won’t want to leave the hotel, though, since it is opulently appointed. Nearly 500 luxury guest rooms, suites and apartments fill the 44-story hotel with luscious accommodations like top-of-the-line linens, oversized bathrooms, high-tech entertainment systems and expansive windows with spectacular views. Special guests may choose an even more exclusive hotel-within-the-hotel option of The Club, located on the private upper floors of Hotel Arts. There, VIPs enjoy a separate reception area, exclusive concierge-team services, a reserved lounge and two-story open-plan apartments.

Guests also relish hydrotherapy pools, steam baths, saunas and relaxing massage treatments at the hotel’s 43 The Spa. Its 43rd-floor location gives guests a bird’s-eye view of the Mediterranean and a tranquil space to reflect and recharge. Even if you traveled to Spain nestled in the nurturing, luxury environment of first class seats, you’ll appreciate the unique serenity of 43 The Spa and all of the Hotel Arts Barcelona perks.

item.title: Relish High Tea Around the World As the Ideal Complement to Discounted First Class Airfare
item.summary: The British tradition of afternoon tea can be a comforting touch of the familiar when traveling to exotic cities around the world. Even if you’ve flown abroad with luxuriously discounted business class tickets, high tea in Canada, Malaysia, Thailand and Japan can soothe a travel-weary soul.
item.bodyColumn_1:
It’s always reassuring to look forward to a touch of tradition and warm comfort after a long first class flight abroad. Sipping afternoon tea and savoring palate-pleasing dishes a luxurious top-tier tea room is one of those prized treats that help ease a trip to a foreign land. 

The Grand Empress, Victoria, Canada
The Grand Empress is imposing with its grand facade and its majestic locale facing the Inner Harbour and the regal British Columbia Parliament building. That grandeur continues to the Grand Empress’ interior and tea room, where luscious tapestries adorn the walls and tables are hand-carved. Tea has been served at the hotel since 1908, featuring the hotel’s signature scones, tasty sandwiches and a variety of pastries. The elegant, traditional high tea fare is served on William Edwards china and accompanied by soothing live piano music.

The Eastern & Oriental, Penang, Malaysia
One of the last things most modern travelers expect to find in the lush, tropical locale of Malaysia is a formal high tea service. At The E&O, though, afternoon tea is quintessentially British, hearkening back to the colonial era where Brits savored Malaysia’s benefits. Served in the luxury hotel’s restaurant 1885, the sweet menu of petit-fours and chocolate-dipped strawberries are complemented with savory sandwiches of salmon, roast beef, cucumber and other fillings. Tea is served on classic blue-and-white porcelain dishes, and the setting is soothing with candlelight, paneled walls and plush seating.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Peninsula Hotel, Tokyo, Japan
Wherever you fly on your luxurious business class flights, a Peninsula Hotel is likely waiting with its world-renowned high tea. The hotel’s Tokyo property is one of the reasons for the company’s reputation for serving a blissful afternoon tea. Its authentically British service includes delicacies like chocolate and pistachio pound cake, fromage mousse and homemade scones, all served on graceful bone china. Offered in the chic, modern setting of The Lobby, the traditional tea is the perfect counterpoint to a bustling, contemporary hotel and city.

Erawan Tea Room, Bangkok, Thailand
Blending Thai and British tradition and cuisine, the Erawan’s tea service is flavorful, colorful and unique. Tea, of course, is the beverage of choice with a wide variety of herbal teas like Bael Fruit Tea. Savory dishes veer toward Thai classics like chicken-curry in pastry puffs, Mar Hor and the delicious lime, coconut, chili and ginger dish of Mieng Krathong Thong. For dessert, guests can expect Chocolate Pudding and other British treats. Tea is such a lovely experience at the Erawan that Lonely Planet named it one of the world’s best. The semi-casual atmosphere and relaxing ambiance are a welcome respite from the cacophony of busy Bangkok, and the price is a perfect complement to the deals you found on discounted first class tickets to Thailand.

item.title: Whisk Yourself Away for a Kiwi Adventure with First Class Deals and Luxury Auckland Resorts
item.summary: Sophisticated, scenic and friendly, Auckland offers a variety of first-rate luxury and boutique hotels for visitors. We list our favorite hotels that give travelers a relaxing respite from the long business class flight to New Zealand and all of the country’s legendary recreation and attractions.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Adventure-seekers have long trekked to New Zealand for thrilling experiences, from “black water” rafting down the Waitomo Caves to descending the 300-meter waterfalls of Sleeping God Canyon. Just because you're adventuring through the country doesn’t mean you have to forgo life’s luxuries, though, especially if you book comfy discounted business class seats to Auckland and top-rated hotels in Aotearoa’s biggest city. Here are some of our favorite luxury Auckland hotels:

Rydges Harbourview
Located in the city center, the Rydges is the newest luxury hotel in the city. Spacious and well-appointed rooms are classically luxurious and feature breathtaking views of the iconic Sky Tower or Waitemata Harbour. While many of Auckland’s finest restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel, guests won’t have to leave the property to find world-class eats. The hotel is home to The CUT on Federal, featuring fresh, local produce and a delectable signature Chateaubriand.

SkyCity Grand Hotel
Resting your weary head is the ultimate pleasure at SkyCity, thanks to a diverse pillow menu gives guests a choice of nine different pillows. That’s just the beginning of the luxurious accommodations, though, since SkyCity also equips rooms with 55-inch plasma televisions, rain-head showers and Puriri Extract exclusive toiletries.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Tasty bites are available 24-hours a day with hotel room service, or guests can dine at one of the hotel’s three superb restaurants. Guests can also relax in the hotel’s day spa or test their luck in the property’s casino. A lucky win may just inspire you to take a last minute first class detour to Sydney for a different type of adventure.

Mollie’s Boutique Hotel
Travelers can find a more personalized luxury experience at this Victorian boutique hotel located on Auckland's St. Mary’s Bay. Graciously furnished, the hotel is known for its spectacular view of the city skyline and cheerful Kiwi hospitality. The hotel’s 10 private suites are perfect for a romantic getaway or a luxury retreat, featuring either harbor, garden or city skyline views. Guests can also enjoy private luxury dining and day spa treatments.

The Langham Auckland
Close to the waterfront and the legendary Auckland Domain, the Langham is a luscious slice of heaven. Guests can rest a spell in the hotel's heated rooftop pool, Jacuzzi and sauna, or keep fit at the health center. Asian and Western dishes are made at eight interactive cooking stations at the hotel’s At Eight restaurant, and high tea is served at Palm Court. The Langham Club offers extra privileges such as butler service and edible treats throughout the day. With all of its luxuries, The Langham is the perfect transition between adventurous escapades and a discounted first class flight home.

item.title: Take in the sights and sounds of Tokyo with luscious five-star hotels and luxury first class flights
item.summary: Business and holiday travelers to Tokyo appreciate the city’s bountiful offerings, from discounted first class tickets to highly personalized service at top-of-the-line hotels. Some of the world’s best hotel brands make their mark in this chic city, from Ritz Carlton and The Peninsula to Grand Hyatt.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Tokyo is eminently cosmopolitan, and its many five-star hotels are equally so. Whether you’re traveling to Tokyo for business or pleasure, the city’s luxury accommodations are the perfect settings to follow pampering business class airfare to Tokyo.

Ritz Carlton Tokyo
The classic luxury brand, Ritz Carlton’s Tokyo property does not disappoint. Its setting is unique, located on the top nine floors of the tallest building in Tokyo, the Midtown Towers. Guests are treated to panoramic views of Mount Fuji and the piped-in scent of chocolate upon arrival. Guests can exercise anytime, day or night, at the hotel’s 24-hour fitness center and dine on scrumptious Michelin-starred fare at Hinokizaka.

The Peninsula Tokyo
It’s tough to go wrong with a hotel that delivers you directly from your flight’s first class seats to the hotel door in a spacious Rolls Royce. With an ideal location near the Imperial Palace and the Marunouchi business district, the brand’s iconic attentive service and abundant high-end amenities are opulent treats for the savvy traveler. The hotel also offers a spa, fine dining and 1,000 pieces of art.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Imperial Hotel Tokyo
Perfectly attentive service is the standard at the Imperial, a favorite of celebrities, royals and heads of state. The property was redesigned in 1920 by Frank Lloyd Wright, and it has the welcoming, grand entrance to prove it. Guests appreciate pampering limousine service, 17 delightful restaurants, a fitness center, a spa and a tea ceremony room. The hotel’s private, soundproof music room is equipped with a Steinway piano so visiting singers and musicians have a useful practice area.

Grand Hyatt Tokyo
Guests marvel at the city views from the Grand Hyatt’s towering indoor swimming pool area. The hotel also gleams with a grand ballroom, seven gorgeous restaurants, three lounges, a full-service spa, a fitness center and lushly appointed guest rooms with fantastic views. Grand Hyatt is conveniently located in the Roppongi Hills, near plenty of visitor-friendly restaurants and shops.

Tokyo is blessed with a bevy of other high-end hotels that satisfy, from the Mandarin Oriental and the Park Hyatt to the Shangri-La Hotel and Hotel New Otani. Combined with widely available discounted first class tickets to Tokyo, the abundance of first-rate hotels makes frequent trips to Japan a pleasure.

item.title: Exploring the World: Mountain-side Eco-Luxury Resorts Are the Perfect Complement to Discounted First Class Seats
item.summary: From the Swiss Alps to Asian tiger reserves, adventurous travelers explore nature luxuriously and conscientiously at some of the world’s best eco-luxury resorts. Enjoy cheap business class tickets to thrilling destinations, then embark on awe-inspiring adventures that connect you to the land and the culture.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Uninspired, you could enjoy a typical luxury holiday by flying first class to your destination, staying in chic high-rise resorts and visiting all of the usual spas, golf courses and nightclubs. Or you can relish new landscapes, cultures and ecologies more intimately at some of the world's most spectacular eco-luxury resorts. There, you can experience the terrain first-hand in supremely comfortable, but environmentally friendly lodging. These lush resorts have taken the world by storm, becoming more available and innovative. Here are just a few of our favorite mountain- and hill-side favorites:

Whitepod Resort, Switzerland
At the base of the Swiss Alps, the Whitepod Resort is a unique property of private, dome-shaped tents. With incredible views overlooking the world-famous Villars ski resort, Whitepod concertedly limits its environmental impact. Motorized vehicles are limited so guests access their domed pods by snowshoe in the winter or by hiking in the summer. Tent platforms are made of wood and can be torn down easily. All power to the site is provided by renewable sources. Waste is recycled, culinary dishes are made with local produce, and certified mountain guides are available for Alpine adventures. The on-site spa also offers a variety of luxury treatments.

The Oberoi Vanyavilas, India
Just 100 miles from Jaipur, The Oberoi is easily accessed with discounted business class tickets to Jaipur International Airport, but its natural setting is a peaceful retreat. Situated on the rim of the Ranthambhore Tiger Reserve, the luxury waterfront jungle resort hearkens back to the time of the Raj.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Guest tents have gleaming teak floors, rich furnishings and inviting four-poster beds draped with silky linens. Guests indulge in a large pillow menu, spa services, two restaurants and a refreshing swimming pool while on the property, or take one of the many tours through the nature sanctuary to spot magnificent tigers and other wildlife. 

Campi Ya Kanzi, Kenya
Guests travel to the "Green Hills of Africa" to revel in stunning vistas of Mt. Kilimanjaro. The five-star resort is beloved for its thrilling wilderness adventures and integration with the Maasai culture. Built with local materials and without cutting down any trees, Campi Ya Kanzi is an environmental masterpiece. Water is harvested from rainwater and heated with solar panels, power is solar-generated, and meals are prepared using coffee-husk charcoal fuel. Guests can choose luxury tent cottages, spacious tent suites or sumptuous rooms in the lodge, and enjoy breathtakingly unique treks led by Maasai trackers. 

We delight in these lush eco-luxury resorts near the world’s mountains and hills, but there are many more adventures to be had. If you are more of a beach and ocean adventurer, stay tuned for our next segment exploring some of the globe's best seaside eco-resorts, all conveniently reachable with cheap first class airfare.

item.title: Living the Good Life with First Class Flights and Beachfront Eco-Luxury Resorts
item.summary: From Cambodia to Canada, the world abounds with beachfront resorts that make the most of their locales. Rather than destroying their natural settings, these resorts take heroic steps to preserve and enhance local communities and wildlife while providing sumptuous five-star accommodations, spas and restaurants in the process.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Why bother taking a luxurious, relaxing first class flight to an exotic location only to stay in a crowded, noisy hotel? Eco-luxury resorts are the perfect antidote to those boisterous city hotels and overpopulated beachfront resorts. With plenty of peace, serenity and high-end services, eco-luxury waterfront resorts are just the place to recharge and rejuvenate.

Song Saa Private Island, Cambodia
Unspoiled and picturesque, Song Saa’s Gulf of Thailand location offers all the beauty and tropical elements of legendary Thai beaches without the crowds. The resort spans the rainforest and the beach and encompasses two private islands and a marine sanctuary. On-staff marine biologists and conservation team members help preserve the area and provide information and activities for guests. Those activities include sea kayaking and snorkeling, rainforest encounter tours, marine safaris, sunrise yoga sessions and cultural and religious experiences that include Buddhist ceremonies and Cambodian cultural immersion.

Although Gili Lankanfushi seems remote, it’s easy to get here by booking discount first class tickets to Male International Airport and enjoying the quick, 20-minute speedboat ride to the resort.


Gili Lankanfushi, Maldives
The “no news, no shoes” philosophy of the resort keeps guests relaxed in this ultimate tropical lagoon location. The spa is perched directly over the crystal-clear lagoon, offering guests soothing massage treatments, outdoor lounging areas and the tranquil sounds of Tibetan bowls. Dining is a delight, too, with an overwater bar, an underground wine cellar and two divine restaurants serving fare fresh from the sea or grown in the resort’s organic garden. With just 44 guest villas, the resort is always peaceful and private-feeling.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Six Senses Hideaway, Ninh Van Bay, Vietnam
If seeing the dramatic cliffs of Ninh Van Bay is on your bucket list, the Six Senses Hideaway is the perfect vantage point. The resort is lush and peaceful with plenty of luxurious villas tucked into the rocks on the bay, along the waterfront and in the hilltop jungle reserve. Guests stay active with weekly treks to the private beach on Bai Nho, tennis matches, morning tai chi sessions, adventure tours and scuba diving. For a little downtime, traditional Vietnamese and signature resort spa treatments keep guests relaxed. With sustainability and the local community in mind, the resort also funds water wells and special projects for local villages and employs two biologists to protect and research the bay’s coral reef.

Wickaninnish Inn, British Columbia, Canada
Delightful beachfront holidays don’t all have to be in tropical locales, though, and Wickaninnish is a prime example. Set on the coast of Vancouver Island, the resort boasts panoramic ocean views as well as scenes of the verdant forest. Wickaninnish was carefully located and built to preserve as much of the forest as possible, and the guest rooms are furnished with pieces made of reclaimed wood. Guests can also indulge in the resort’s many spa services, knowing that the oils and lotions are produced responsibly. All ingredients for the resort’s meals are sourced locally, and special boilers were installed on-property to reduce carbon emissions. Even getting to the resort gives guests a chance to view the area’s natural beauty. Whether you take a last minute business class flight to Seattle or enjoy first class airfare to Vancouver, you can ferry over to Wickaninnish Inn while relishing all of the incredible tiny islands and forest scenery along the way.

item.title: Explore India in Luxury with Discounted First Class Tickets and Posh All-Suite Cruises on the Ganges
item.summary: A luxury holiday to India is more adventure-filled with Uniworld’s newest cruise vacation along the Ganges River. The new all-suite riverboat envelops travelers in sumptuous luxury while taking them through the heart of the country, from New Delhi and Kolkata to religious sites like Rajbari.
item.bodyColumn_1:
After a long, international first class flight to India, you want to make the most of your trip by visiting many different Indian cities. But if you don’t enjoy the unpacking and re-packing that goes along with multi-city journeys, a cruise is a great option. 

Luckily, cruising in India will be more luxurious and exotic with the launching of Uniworld’s new all-suite ship this January 2016. Combining posh accommodations with some of the world’s most spectacular scenery and historic cities, Uniworld’s Ganges Voyager II is the epitome of palatial travel.

The itinerary alone is irresistible, taking you from the bustling streets of New Delhi to the vibrant city of Kolkata. You’ll begin with a land tour of India’s Golden Triangle, exploring the magnificent Taj Mahal and the glorious “pink city” of Jaipur. There, you can also visit important sites like Mother Teresa’s home and tomb. A quick flight to Kolkata transports travelers to the cruise ship, where cultural performances and more adventures await. Be sure to check on the availability of cheap first class tickets to Kolkata for an extra splash of luxury on your journey.

While sailing along the sacred Ganges River, you’ll enjoy breathtaking views of the river and passing villages. Accommodations are strictly five-star luxury. Each cabin suite is beautifully appointed with rich, inviting furnishings like four-poster beds, fine linens and French or Juliette balconies.
item.bodyColumn_2:
En-suite bathrooms are equally sumptuous with marble furnishings, rain showers and exclusive Molton Brown bath amenities. Ceilings are high for an inviting, open ambiance, and closets are roomy. Some suites also include butler service and complimentary spa treatment.

In Kolkata, you can explore the city’s British Colonial history, from compelling architecture to museum exhibits at Victoria Memorial Hall. Abundant temples are found in Kalna, where the Rajbari complex allows travelers to see some of India’s spiritual sites.

The next stop is Matiari, where you can immerse yourself in Indian life and culture at the artisans’ village. On ship, a mehndi demonstration explores the art of henna and its meaning.

For the next three days, you disembark to a world of adventure, from the Hare Krishna birthplace of Mayapur to a horse cart ride to Katra Mosque. On ship entertainment and activities are equally thrilling with experiences like Bollywood-style shows.

The 13-day cruise experience also gives travelers the option of a three-day extension to explore the country’s holiest city, Varanasi. Whether you choose to continue on to Varanasi or not, check with us to find the best deals on first class tickets to and from India.

item.title: First Class Flights and First Class Lodging: Enjoying the Luxury and Culture of Phum Baitang
item.summary: There are dozens of excellent reasons to explore the rich history and culture of Cambodia’s Angkor Temple region, and Phum Baitang gives us even more. We review the ways the new luxury resort and a first class flight to the region can enrich your journey.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The recent opening of the five-star Phum Baitang resort near Cambodia's Angkor temples reminds us that you don't have to make-do with uncomfortable lodging, even if you are on an enlightening or spiritual journey. So book those discounted business class tickets to Siem Reap International Airport, and we’ll list the reasons you’ll love Phum Baitang just as much as we do.

Authentic Cambodian design
Just minutes from Siem Reap, the resort is tucked into the Cambodian countryside so it’s fitting that the property’s 45 villas resemble traditional Cambodian architecture. The resort’s stilted villas are made of wood, mimicking the appearance of local farming houses. Palm trees and paddy fields surround the villas, creating the perfect setting for a resort whose name is Khmer for “green village.”

Serene Villas
The collection of villas themselves offer a sense of privacy, but their artful scattering around the property makes you feel as if you are part of a small town. Furnishings and amenities offer a dash of luxury, with some of the villas featuring private terraces and others offering private plunge pools. Spacious and relaxing outdoor lounging spaces are worked into the design of each of the villas, and the soaking tubs and roomy bathrooms are nothing short of sublime. Antique wooden furniture in keeping with the Cambodian aesthetic, luxurious linens, comfortable sofas and dozens of other amenities fill the villas with cozy warmth and indulgent pleasure.

Plenty of Relaxation
The on-site Spa Temple is intimate and rejuvenating, giving you delightful opportunities to enjoy a massage, practice yoga or simply meditate in a tranquil, candle-filled setting.
item.bodyColumn_2:
If you prefer a little pampering, the spa offers a steam room, a sauna and seven treatment rooms for single or couples massages. There’s also a fitness room and yoga pavilion for times when you feel the need to stretch and work your muscles, especially after your long, business class flight to Cambodia.

Sumptuous Services and Enrichment
Cooking classes with the resort’s chef help you master the art of Cambodian cuisine and learn about local produce on chef-led trips to the local market. A concierge is on staff to help you enjoy all of the Khmer experiences you want, and an on-site kids club gives your children a chance to learn more about the Khmer culture. The resort’s boutique is fully stocked with local wares, perfect for souvenirs of your time in Cambodia. 

Unique Experiences
Phum Baitang puts you in the heart of amazing Cambodian landmarks and experiences. Be sure to take the trek out to the Temples of Angkor archeological park to explore some of the most important relics of the Khmer Empire. Nearby, you’ll also find the magnificent and extremely biodiverse Tonle Sap Lake, Phnom Kulen National Park and captivating villages of Kompong Phluk. Make time to head into Siem Reap, too, so you can explore the Phsar Chas market in the Old French Quarter. You can also enjoy the region with special helicopter rides, Vespa tours, Vintage Jeep tours or buffalo cart rides.

However you choose to spend your time in Cambodia, the Phum Baitang will keep you so relaxed and pampered that you won’t want to get back on that airplane home, even if you’ve booked spacious first class seats.

item.title: First Class Christmas Spirit: Strasbourg’s Christmas Markets and Luxury First Class Flights
item.summary: From sensational light displays to delicious bakery treats, Strasbourg’s Christmas markets celebrate the joy of the season. We review some of the Christmas Markets’ best features, local activities and five-star hotels. Now’s a great time to book your business class flights to Strasbourg to enjoy the activities.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Nothing gets you in the holiday spirit better than the delectable scents, sparkling lights, scrumptious treats and rousing bonhomie found in Europe's famed Christmas markets. Luckily, now's the perfect time to book discounted business class tickets to Strasbourg to experience the ultimate of all holiday markets, Christkindelsmärik.

Repeatedly voted the best of Europe's Christmas markets, Christkindelsmärik is also the oldest, established in 1570. From the end of November to December 31, Strasbourg is enveloped by Christmas, offering 300 chalets filled with luscious baked goods, local crafts, aromatic pine trees, chorale and dance performances, holiday parades and all the special touches that make an Alsatian holiday so enticing. With 11 different Christmas markets spread throughout the village, visitors can spend weeks enjoying them all. If you don't have that much time, here are a few highlights you shouldn't miss:

The Great Christmas Tree in Place Kléber, in the Village of Sharing, is stunning at 98-feet tall. As the centerpiece of the market, new lighting effects on the tree are revealed each week, making each visit to the tree a delightful surprise.

The Christmas lights throughout the city are spectacular, but the display creating the entrance to the market is magnificent.

If you have kids in your party, you can't miss the outdoor ice rink in Place Dauphine. Reserved for kids, the ice rink is a great way for little ones to burn off some of that extra energy.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Best of all, if you're looking to engage in some fantastic winter sports, you won't even need to hop onto another first class flight to another European city. The region's exciting ski resorts are just an hour or two from Strasbourg. To the east and south are Germany's famed Black Forest ski resorts, including Sasbachwalden, Steinach and Baiersbonn. For those who want to stay in France, the exquisite Vosges Mountain ski resorts are just two hours to the southwest.

After a day spent skiing or relishing the city's Christmas markets, there are several pampering five-star hotels in Strasbourg perfect for resting and recharging. Sofitel Strasbourg Grande Ile is the epitome of luxury in the heart of Strasbourg's historic center. Colorful public areas lead to beautifully appointed guest rooms filled with classically lush furnishings and linens. 

Chateau d'Ile is close enough to the historic areas to be convenient but far enough away to provide a little extra peace and quiet. This small boutique luxury hotel’s room are lavish and comfortable, many offering views of the river, private saunas and relaxing balconies.

If you're short on time or want to experience more than just Strasbourg's holiday market, consider one of the many Christmas on the Rhine cruises. AmaWaterways, Grand Circle Cruise Line, Viking and a host of other European River cruise lines stop in Strasbourg
for a day of Christmas revelry. Many of these cruises originate in Zurich, so check with our travel professionals for the best first class deals to Switzerland when you're booking your trip.

item.title: Fly on Luxurious One-Way First Class Flights to Budapest for A Luxury Train Adventure Through Europe
item.summary: Experience the history, architecture, passion and conflict that define many European cities on a first-rate Balkan train odyssey. Fly in first class luxury to Budapest and board the lavishly appointed Golden Eagle Danube Express. You’ll explore ancient European towns, see legendary Romanian sites and revel in Venice.
item.bodyColumn_1:
With the abundance of cheap first class flights, five-star cruise lines and bespoke land tours, it's easy to forget about the luxury options of traveling by train. We are especially enchanted by the possibilities offered by Golden Eagle's summer Balkan Odyssey. The land cruise whisks travelers through some of the world's most historic and beautiful European cities and countrysides. 

This breathtaking summer adventure begins in gorgeous Budapest, where travelers enjoy views of the Danube River, the stunning Buda Castle and other exquisitely designed buildings, public spaces and landscapes. Once travelers arrive in Budapest, they are chauffeured to their five-star hotel where they’ll stay for two days so they can relish the spectacular sights of Buda and Pest.

After a glorious day exploring Budapest's World Heritage Sites, travelers board the Golden Eagle Danube Express, where spacious deluxe cabins with ensuite bathrooms offer every conceivable high-end amenity. Guests have access to 24-hour personal service, a bar lounge car and an impeccably appointed dining car. An executive chef oversees all meals to ensure that guests have a delightful culinary experience throughout the 12-day journey.

From Budapest, the train glides on to other Hungarian towns like Lajosmizse to see a "Puszta" horse show and Kecskemét. In Romania, train stops in Sighisoara allow travelers to tour the site believed to be the birthplace of Dracula, and Brasov to roam Bran Castle
item.bodyColumn_2:
Days 5 and 6 are spent traveling through Bulgaria, stopping in historic towns like Veliko Tarnovo and Sofia. 

While we always appreciate the pampering convenience and speed of first class flights, this luxury train journey gives travelers a chance to experience the countryside and communities in a more intimate way. After Bulgaria, guests can explore the medieval tombs, fortresses and Turkish baths of Belgrade and the Ottoman Empire relics in Mostar. Travelers will even gain some insight into Sarajevo's struggles during the Balkan War.

Next, it's on to Croatia to stroll through the ancient town center of Zagreb and Slovenia to explore the treasures of Ljubljana. The final two days of the luxury train tour take travelers through the celebrated Italian cities of Trieste and Venice. Once in Venice, guests transfer to a posh five-star hotel near Doge's Palace, St. Mark's Square and the Bridge of Sighs. 

Since travelers aren't locked into round-trip airfare, they can choose to linger in Venice even longer than Golden Eagle tour dates, soaking up the unique atmosphere and experiencing the tastes, sights and artistry of The Floating City. We are happy to help travelers find cheap first class airfare from Venice's Marco Polo Airport so they can spend as much time in Venice as possible.

item.title: A Business Class Flight of a Different Sort: Cooking Your Way Through the World
item.summary: From Italy to Bali, the world is literally your oyster if you fly with cheap business class tickets and participate in cooking classes at your destination’s luxury resort. We list a few of the world’s best resorts with programs designed to help you experience the region’s culture.
item.bodyColumn_1:
One of the best ways to experience a new land is through its food, and if you’re a foodie, you’re probably itching to find a local to teach you to make some favorite regional dishes. Whether you’re looking for a relaxing activity while you’re away on business or simply jetting off on a first class flight for fun, taking a local cooking class offers a terrific glimpse into the lives of locals. 

Hotel Il Saviatino - Florence, Italy
It’s no surprise that some of the best and most beloved culinary experiences are available in Italian resorts. Food is love here, and the Il Saviatino offers it through their own dining experiences and a chance to savor the fare at other Tuscan restaurants. The hotel’s Florentine Food for Thoughts experience is a delightful combination of luxury accommodations at the hotel, a private three-hour walking tour of Florence’s street food options and a truffle-hunting experience like no other.

Belmond La Residence d’Angkor - Siem Reap, Cambodia
The Belmond has so many activities and options to explore that you’ll want to be sure to find discounted business class tickets to the region so you can indulge to your heart’s content. One of the resort’s most celebrated activities is its Cookery Class and Market Visit. First, you’ll stroll through the colorful Psa Leu market, where the sights, sounds and aromas of locally grown produce and spices are a treat. Then, you’ll head back to the resort where you learn traditional Khmer cooking techniques in a sumptuous outdoor kitchen.
item.bodyColumn_2:
RIMBA Jimbaran - Bali, Indonesia
Overlooking the dramatic waves crashing against the massive Jimbaran Bay Rock, RIMBA Jimbaran is simply captivating. Aside from its lushly appointed guest rooms and gorgeous gardens, RIMBA offers its Scenography Cooking School. Heading to the local pasar, or market, is a daily activity for locals, so that’s where your cooking tour begins. Back at the resort you’ll join a Balinese temple ritual, then explore all of the tastes, smells and components of Balinese cuisine. 

La Maison Arabe - Marrakech, Morocco
Luxurious Moroccan furnishings, beautiful guest rooms and attentive service have been the hallmarks of La Maison Arabe for decades. Its cooking classes are equally sumptuous. Ideally located in the heart of Marrakech’s Old Town, the boutique hotel is just steps from the vibrant Jemaa el Fna market. You may want to explore the local market before taking the cooking class, just to get a hint of the pleasures in store. The resort’s culinary class provides a local dada, traditional Moroccan cook, to lead you in your cooking adventures. By the end of the course, you will have made a traditional Moroccan dessert or appetizer and gained new insights into Moroccan culture.

There are dozens of other amazing cooking classes found at resorts around the world. The next time you travel for work or pleasure, check out the options, and remember to call us for cheap first class tickets to all of your preferred destinations.

item.title: Galloping Toward Adventure: Cheap First Class Tickets and Exotic Ranches Are the Perfect Combo
item.summary: Ride along the range, relax on picturesque porches and indulge in delightful cuisine. With stunning guest ranches in New Zealand, Argentina and Canada offering all of life’s most thrilling adventures, a business class flight to any of these countries can take you to thrilling ranch vacations.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The American West is known for its pioneer spirit and sprawling ranches, but it’s not the only place to find exciting, luxury guest ranch experiences. From Argentina and New Zealand to Canada, you can fly in comfy first class seats to all sorts of exotic destinations to find thrilling guest ranch experiences. 

Canada
Known for its Calgary Stampede, celebrated cattle ranches and stunning scenery, Canada is fertile ground for luxury guest ranches. British Columbia especially teems with exhilarating, sumptuous ranches. Turn-of-the-century Little Beaver Creek is an exclusive option, offering its log chateaux to only 12 guests at a time and meticulously serving elegant cuisine and other engaging comforts. Ride around Glimpse Lake on horseback, canoe along hidden ponds or kick back on a welcoming porch to soak in the incredible views. Little Beaver Creek is just one of many satisfying British Columbia guest ranches, including Echo Valley Ranch and Spa, Free Rein, Siwash Lake Ranch, Tod Mountain Ranch and Three Bars Ranch.

New Zealand
If you’re jetting farther afield to Oceania, be sure to check out deals on business class flights that give you more room to relax. Then enjoy your stay in the country’s vast and pampering guest ranches. The South Island is the place to go for most of the country’s rambling spreads, home to stunning guest ranches, or stations, like Grasmere Lodge.
item.bodyColumn_2:
The High Country resort gives guests a unique stay among New Zealand’s legendary Southern Alps.

Blanket Bay in Queenstown is another prime location for attentive service, beautiful Southern Alpine views and breathtaking adventures like helicopter tours of Milford Sound, heli-skiing and horseback riding. Other amazing New Zealand guest stations include Beaumont High Country Experience and Matakauri Lodge.

Argentina
Live like an authentic gaucho or relax like a king in Argentina’s extraordinary guest ranches. Estancia El Colibri in Cordoba is known for its colonial-style architecture and refined amenities. High-end furnishings and surround-sound media fill its guest suites, while Finnish saunas, Jacuzzis and a refreshing swimming pool provide soothing relaxation. In addition to the usual estancia activities, this ranch offers sensational polo activities. Other Argentinian luxury ranches include Posada de la Laguna and Estancia de los Lunas.

With all of these indulgent guest ranches available around the world, your luxurious holiday abroad doesn’t have to restrict you to the typical urban hotel or seaside resort. The next time you book a discounted first class flight to Canada, Argentina or New Zealand, consider one of these magnificent guest ranches to enrich your stay.

item.title: Luxury on the Costa Smeralda: Pair Discounted First Class Seats with a Stay at Hotel Cala di Volpe, the World’s Second Most Expensive Hotel
item.summary: Sunshine, rugged Mediterranean coast and hills dotted with whitewashed Sardinian homes are iconic features of Italy’s Costa Smeralda. We take a look at the region’s celebrated Hotel Cala di Volpe and offer up discounted first class flights to help balance the hotel’s exclusive price tag.
item.bodyColumn_1:
The Emerald Coast’s Hotel Cala di Volpe received some notoriety this summer when it was named the second most expensive hotel in the world. The list reminded us that, unlike discounted first class airfare, some luxury items just aren’t meant to be cheap. It also piqued our interest in the Sardinian resort’s amenities. 

Just what does the double-room price of $1,789 buy at Cala di Volpe? Sumptuous linens, classic Mediterranean design, ceramic tile floors, whitewashed walls and private balconies are just a sampling of the hotel’s guest room delights. The property also offers more exclusive, spacious suites with private terraces and deluxe suites with hand-painted Sardinian furnishings, picture windows, terraces and relaxing seating areas. The apex of the hotel’s comfort is the three-bedroom Presidential Suite, featuring a rooftop terrace with ample deck chairs, a solarium, a private swimming pool and windows that let you bask in the beauty of the turquoise Mediterranean.

The property itself is all that you expect when you book discounted first class tickets to the Costa Smeralda. The hotel appears almost like a Sardinian village, sprawling along the secluded bay. It features a private beach, incomparable views of the hills and visions of sailboats bobbing along the ocean.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Relaxing is easy in this romantic setting, especially with the on-site spa’s soothing massage sessions and attentive bar service at the saltwater swimming pool. Even with these tranquil amenities, the hotel is rich with recreation. Three tennis courts, a fitness center, access to the local Pevero Golf Club Costa Smeralda and other Sardinian offerings keep guests fit and actively experiencing the distinctive Mediterranean climate. 


Dining is delectable here. The Cala di Volpe Restaurant boasts a menu filled with traditional Sardinian and Mediterranean dishes like squash filled with creamy ricotta and fresh cannelloni overflowing with bechamel sauce and savory chopped beef. Its romantic, refined setting draws travelers and locals from all along the coast looking for an epicurean adventure. The resort’s Barbecue restaurant is the place to go for fresh seafood grilled to perfection, and its wine tasting venue and bars add an extra touch of palate-pleasing delights.

In a region known for its incredible seaside resorts and opulent amenities, the Cala di Volpe is a standout. So while it’s terrific to save on discounted first class tickets, you’ll appreciate the luxury and service of a more exclusive stay at Cala di Volpe.

item.title: Save on First Class Flights So You Can Stay in the World’s Most Expensive Hotels
item.summary: From the Cote d’Azur to the American Southwest’s desert canyons, the world abounds with posh luxury hotels. We take a look at a few of the hotels appearing on Luxury Travel Magazine’s list of the 10 most expensive hotels so you can explore the world in style.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Luxury travel may begin with booking luscious first class airfare, but finding indulgent, pampering hotels is just as important. Luckily, there are plenty of gorgeous resorts around the globe to satisfy your exacting demands. This year, Polynesian delights and French Riviera gems are just a few of the hotels topping Luxury Travel Magazine’s most expensive hotels list, and we recommend you try a few of them out. Last week, we profiled the list’s No. 2 hotel, Cala di Volpe, but it’s worth taking a look at some of the other hotels that made the Top 10.

Two U.S. hotels are featured on this year’s list with Canyon Point, Utah’s Amangiri hotel leading the pack. Known for its incredible location tucked among the canyon cliffs, Amangiri’s $1,899-a-night fee includes a spacious suite, breathtaking desert views and access to adventures like hot-air balloon rides and fossil hunting. Maui’s beautiful Montage Kapalua Bay hotel is No. 5 on the list.

Those of you booking first class tickets to the Mediterranean have a wide variety of high-end options from Luxury Travel Magazine’s list. The Cote d’Azur is home to two properties: Cap Estel and La Reserve. With its stunning peninsula location, Cap Estel is just 10 minutes from Monaco, making it easy for guests to enjoy an elegant night at the tables.
item.bodyColumn_2:
The magnificent hotel is acclaimed for its panoramic views, attentive service and dozens of chic amenities. 

If you prefer the Italian Mediterranean, Sardinian hotels are well-represented on the list, taking three of the 10 spots. In addition to the previously featured Cala di Volpe, Hotel Pitrizza and Villa del Parco at Forte Village Resort are Nos. 6 and 9 on the list, respectively. Guests of the Hotel Pitrizza can sunbathe on the property’s private beach, cool off in a seawater pool carved into the natural rock or head into town for a night of socializing, dancing and glamor. Best of all, some of the hotel’s spacious rooms, villas and private suites feature spectacular views of the renowned Costa Smeralda. 

Easter Island’s Explora Rapa Nui hotel provides an ambrosial Polynesian experience, ranking No. 3 on the World’s Most Expensive Hotel list at $1,733 a night. Guests here can disconnect from the rat race of everyday life, immersing themselves in the quiet of an island paradise. 

Other hotels on the list include Chile’s Explora Atacama and Venice’s Aman Canal Grande, so even if you’re flying with first class tickets to South America or inland European cities, there are many elite choices.

item.title: Part One: Legendary Ski Resorts That Will Have You Booking First Class Flights This Winter
item.summary: An exhilarating ski holiday is the perfect antidote to the wintertime blues. To help you find that perfect ski vacation, we list some of the world’s top ski regions and their lavish hotels and offer up some incredible first class deals to make your trip complete.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Winter is indeed a wonderland if you love to ski, and now is the perfect time to book your first and business class tickets for winter travel. You won’t be on the slopes around the clock, though, and you’ll need a luxury hotel to complete your stay. In this first of a three-part blog, we list some of the world’s most exclusive mountain resorts and hotels. Whether you plan to ski, meet new people, relax or enjoy a fireside drink, these properties are the perfect winter escape.

Courchevel 1850, France
We’ve profiled Courchevel 1850 before for its high-profile guests, stunning setting in the Trois Vallee ski area and Michelin-starred restaurants. There are more than a handful of five-star hotels in the heart of Courchevel 1850, including Hotel Le Kilimandjaro where your private butler caters to your every whim. There are other notable hotels to consider in Courchevel 1850:
- Les Grandes Alpes offers a chic spa and fitness center as well as incredible views of La Croisette.
- Les Airelles provides ski in/ski out service, a ski valet and a private wintertime ice rink that endears the property to families.
-L’Apogee is one of the newer properties in Courchevel 1850, as well-known for its lively ice skating galas and nighttime ski parties as for its location at the peak of an Olympic ski jump.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Lech-Zürs, Arlberg, Austria
Frequented by European royals and celebrities, Zürs is a cozier version of Courchevel 1850. It’s also conveniently located, easy to get to by train once your first class flight lands in Austria, Germany or Switzerland. Zürs is connected to the picturesque village of Lech by ski lifts and pistes, offering visitors a wide range of lodging and recreational options. Back-country skiing is popular here, but the variety of groomed runs are just as enticing. While Lech and Zürs are low-key, their hotels are opulent and glamorous. 
-Hotel Zürserhof is one of the top luxury hotels in the world, offering a variety of majestic rooms and suites, some with butler service. Personal coaching, a multi-purpose sports hall, tennis courts, a fitness center and a relaxing whirlpool are just a few of the recreation and fitness options here. The culinary services are equally sublime.
-Thurnher’s Alphenhof is similarly equipped with luxurious rooms and suites, ample sports facilities, rejuvenating spa services and delectable dining options. 

We’re just getting started on the glorious ski resorts located around the world, so be sure to check back in for the next two installments of our series. In the meantime, check out our many first class airfare deals to Europe for travel this winter.

item.title: Part Two: Legendary Ski Resorts That Will Have You Booking First Class Flights This Winter
item.summary: Iconic for its Edelweiss, Matterhorn and Alpine architecture, the Swiss Alps offer an iconic ski holiday. We take a look at three of Switzerland’s most exclusive ski areas and offer five-star hotel suggestions for this second part of our three-part series on top-rated international ski resorts.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Easy to get to via first class airfare and rich in Alpine pistes and gorgeous ski resorts, Switzerland is a popular winter playground for the well-to-do. In part two of our three-part series detailing the world’s most exclusive ski areas, we take a look at some of the country’s most incredible winter wonderlands.

Klosters-Serneus, Switzerland
A famous ski spot for British royals and other international celebrities and VIPs, Klosters is intimate and posh. It is home to the legendary bar at Hotel Chesa Grischuna and the Casa Antica nightclub, known for its famed patrons and events. Prince Charles notably stays at Hotel Walserhof, where the suites are spacious, comfortable and very well-appointed. In nearby Davos, there are several chic hotels, including:
-Rixos Flüela Davos gleams with glitzy furnishings and ample amenities such as a fitness center, spa and indoor swimming pool.
- Hotel Seehof Davos delights foodies with its Michelin-starred restaurant and many spa, recreation and fitness amenities. The hotel is home-away-from-home for many world leaders attending the annual World Economic Forum.

Zermatt, Switzerland
It’s not often that you get to ski in the shadow of the Matterhorn, but a trip to Zermatt can help you realize that dream. Skiing is actually possible here yearround, but winter is magical in Zermatt with its ice caves, ice sculptures and winter activities. There are some truly beautiful hotels in the area:
-Hotel Mont Cervin Palace is classically elegant, transporting guests from the train station to the hotel via a cozy red horse-drawn carriage.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Guest rooms are beautifully appointed, and hotel services include a peaceful wellness and beauty spa.
-Grand Hotel Zermatterhof is just as gracious as the Mont Cervin, providing guests incredible views of the surrounding mountains, magnificent furnishings and lush restaurants and spa services. 
Cars are not allowed in Zermatt, so book our discounted first class airfare to Geneva, drive to Tasch and hop on the Matterhorn Gotthard Bahn.

St. Moritz, Switzerland
Glamorous and glitzy, St. Moritz is the ultimate ski destination for the well-heeled upper class. Skiing is just one of St. Moritz’s famous pastimes, though, since visitors also enjoy shopping in the city’s many elegant boutiques, attending swanky polo tournaments and zipping down the thrilling Cresta Toboggan Run. There are several gorgeous five-star hotels in St. Moritz:
-Badrutt’s Palace is a unique and historic hotel that caters to royalty, professional athletes, celebrities and other movers and shakers. A private ice rink, sleigh rides, tennis courts and countless other amenities keep guests entertained when they’re not on the pistes.
-Hotel Kulm is another favorite for its classic beauty, rich accommodations and activities that include tennis, horseback riding, fine dining and spa treatments.
-Kempinski Grand Hotel is an award-winning property treasured for its castle-like design, exquisite restaurants, casino gaming and ski in/ski out provisions.

Whichever Swiss ski resort you choose, don’t forget to check out our first class ticket deals to Geneva and Zurich.

item.title: Part Three: Legendary Ski Resorts That Will Have You Booking First Class Flights This Winter
item.summary: Stay closer to home this winter with a luscious ski holiday to two of Canada’s most spectacular ski regions. Your first class tickets to Vancouver or Calgary put you within easy driving distance to picturesque Whistler Blackcomb and Banff, where legendary skiing and sublime hotels await.
item.bodyColumn_1:
While flying in first class seats to Europe may provide the ultimate ski vacation, there are dozens of other prime ski resorts around the globe and some are even close to home. In part three of our series on the world’s best ski destinations, we take a look at the fabulous ski lodging options in gorgeous Canada.

Banff, Canada
Known for its statuesque mountains, rejuvenating hot springs and spectacular scenery, Banff is a skier’s paradise. Whether you prefer the World Cup ski runs of Lake Louise Mountain Resort, the Continental Divide’s glorious Sunshine Village pistes or the ski racing trails of Mt. Norquay, there are several lush hotels to serve you

- Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise is a stately castle on the shores of the scenic lake and a haven for travelers who want to experience all of Banff’s recreational opportunities. In typical Fairmont fashion, the hotel offers an extra touch of luxury with its Fairmont Gold private concierge service, a pampering full-service spa and ample fine dining. There’s even authentic fondue service in its Walliser Stube restaurant.

- Fairmont Banff Springs is unparalleled for its grandeur, known as the “Castle if the Rockies.” Nestled within Banff National Park’s forest, the luxury hotel abounds with amenities, from a championship golf course to a top-tier spa. Foodies staying at the hotel are also in for a treat, with delectable Japanese, Italian, Canadian and Alpine dishes on the menu at the hotel’s various restaurants.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Whistler Blackcomb, Canada

If you live on the West Coast, a quick first class flight to Vancouver is the perfect link to a lush Whistler getaway. Home to the 2010 Olympics’ alpine skiing and luge events, Whistler Blackcomb is the largest ski area in all of North America. The world’s elite flock to the resort, drawn to the ski area’s two spectacular mountains, world-class ski schools and breathtaking heli-skiing.

- The Four Seasons Resort Whistler is a delight, from its grand architecture to its legendary Four Seasons Bed. Guests enjoy group fitness classes, personal training sessions and a wide variety of equipment in the fitness center, access to a number of nearby championship golf courses, a ski concierge and delectable restaurants. 

- Fairmont Chateau Whistler was named Canada’s No. 1 Ski Hotel by Conde Nast Traveler for its superior comfort and service. The magazine also rated it as the top golf resort in the country so there are plenty of recreation options year-round. Guests can swim laps while enjoying underwater music in one of the two heated pools, an on-site theater, tennis and squash courts, renowned golf course and ski in/ski out facilities. Even getting to the resort is sublime with discounted first class tickets to Vancouver and a quick drive to Whistle via the scenic Sea-to-Sky Highway.

item.title: Christmas Beyond the Markets: Fun Places to Fly with First Class Tickets This Winter
item.summary: From Finland to Rome, the world overflows with cities offering memorable places to celebrate the winter holiday season. They’re also prime locations for fun activities and luxury hotels. Book cheap first class tickets today so you can trek to these fun locales and create a once-in-a-lifetime Christmas.
item.bodyColumn_1:
Europe’s authentic Christmas markets get a lot of attention this time of year, but there are plenty of other reasons you’ll want to start searching for first class tickets to Europe this winter. Here are a few of our favorite European cities that offer memorable holiday festivities:

Lapland, Finland
Rather than waiting for Santa to visit your home, why not take the family to visit Santa in his official hometown of Rovaniemi, Finland? There, Santa’s Village greets visitors with dozens of shops, attractions, restaurants and activities such as snowmobiling and reindeer sleigh rides. The zoo features Arctic animals like polar bears and huskies, and the science center delves into phenomena of the Northern Lights. Of course, the main draw here at Christmastime is the holiday village where kids can help Santa’s elves with their chores and make cookies with Mrs. Claus. For lodging, check out the igloo hotel for a truly northern experience or look for luxury hotels like the Arctic Light Hotel and the Original Sokos Hotel Vaakuna Rovaniemi.

Quebec City, Canada
If you’d rather stay within North America, Quebec City is an excellent destination for those shorter first or business class flights. The city transforms into a Victorian town during the season, complete with carolers, candlelight and Victorian storytelling.
item.bodyColumn_2:
Thousands of twinkling lights create magical experiences in neighborhoods like Rue de Petit-Champlain, Palace Royale, Grande Allée and Sous-le-Fort Street. The city’s German Christmas market provides a glimpse into Old World traditions, but there are plenty of modern holiday touches like nighttime luge rides, Christmas concerts and the ice sculpture and 500,000 lights of Festi Lumiere. Quebec City is also home to several five-star hotels, including Auberge Saint-Antoine, Hotel Le Germain-Dominion and Fairmont Le Chateau Frontenac.


Rome, Italy
Rome may not be the first place you think of when you plan your winter holidays, but it’s actually a spectacular place to celebrate the season. Many of the city’s streets are decorated with festive lights, and several Christmas markets offer abundant celebrations. Of course, the big draw during the holidays is the Pope’s Christmas Eve Midnight Mass held at St. Peter’s Basilica. Other magnificent experiences in Rome include outdoor ice skating, touring the many nativity scenes and enjoying the immense Christmas trees erected in St. Peter’s Square, the Colosseum and Piazza Venezia. There’s also a spectacular Menorah on display in Piazza Barberini to celebrate Hanukkah. Rome is relatively easy to get to, and its busy Fiumicino Airport is a prime destination for finding discounted first class airfare.

item.title: One More Reason to Book Business Class Seats to Morocco: the Four Seasons Casablanca
item.summary: Casablanca’s only beachfront hotel, the newly opened Four Seasons is an ideal place to stay for business or pleasure. After flying in luxurious business class seats to Mohammed V International, travelers can head to the Four Seasons to relax with lush guest rooms and lavish spa treatments.
item.bodyColumn_1:
We don’t often feature Casablanca in our blogs, but it is truly one of the most unique and captivating cities to visit. With 7.25 million people flying into Casablanca’s Mohammed V International Airport each year, there are often discounted business class tickets available for the destination. As of last month, there’s also a new spectacular luxury hotel in the city: the Four Seasons Casablanca.

The only oceanfront hotel in the entire city, the Four Seasons is a marvel of plush accommodations, attentive service, intricate Arabic design and breathtaking scenery. Just 10 minutes from the business district, the hotel is a convenient retreat from bustling city activity. To add to the hotel’s unique flair, it is set into the White City’s oceanfront cliffs, and it is part of the high-end ANFA neighborhood featuring exclusive restaurants and shops. The Four Seasons is also near Hassan II Mosque, renowned for its breathtaking architecture and the tallest minaret in the world.

The hotel’s 183 guest rooms and suites are stunning, featuring all of the usual Four Seasons delights such as the Four Seasons bed, luxurious furnishings and twice-daily housekeeping service. Most rooms have balconies with incredible views of the Atlantic Ocean, the Corniche of Casablanca and other legendary local sites.
item.bodyColumn_2:
While all of the guest rooms are gorgeous, the hotel’s Royal Suite is simply amazing. Floor-to-ceiling windows and a private terrace make the most of the suite’s captivating views, and an indoor-outdoor fireplace is a soothing touch of warmth. If you’ve booked business class seats into Casablanca for a conference or event at the hotel, you’re in for a superb treat. The meeting accommodations and ballroom are sublime, with an incredibly designed ceiling filled with bespoke chandeliers and lanterns.

While on the property, be sure to take advantage of the hotel’s many amenities, especially Le Spa. Offering a refreshing aquatic experience that incorporates experience showers, the spa provides whirlpools, steam rooms, an ice fountain, a 24-hour fitness center and a full menu of spa treatments. A resort-style pool and private cabanas are located in the hotel’s fulsome gardens.

Dining and socializing on-site are equally pleasurable, with a choice of three restaurants and bars. French and Arabic cuisine and delectable libations are their specialties. 

Even if Casablanca isn’t your final destination, the Four Seasons is the perfect stopover for business class flights that continue on to other North African cities like Marrakech, Algiers and Tunis.
